description:
Paintings on the wall. 
Wall seats and leathers reminded me of trains.
Coffee and nuts tasted great.
author: Emilie G.

description:
Very cool wine bar in the Western Addition and close to AMC Kabuki theater. Came here before a Saturday night movie and it's an amazing vibe with people working and drinking alike. There were games, cheese plates and they have amazing house-made sangria. 

Other than the cheese plate it seemed like they had a few small bites and snacks but no full menu. 

Very cool bar and vibe and worth a stop if you're in the Western Addition
author: Liz S.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to chill and work for a few hours. I love the vibe of the space and the strong wifi doesn't hurt either. I could easily spend 2-3 hours in here with a drink, headphones or not. 

Service is a hit or miss, depending on time of day, and honestly the mood that they're in. I'd also probably suggest expanding their menu for snacks and be more considerate on the volume of the music. The vibe at night is of course different from the daytime, but it's rough when I can hear their music through my headphones on a Tuesday afternoon.
author: Lucy Z.

description:
Voted "Best Date Bar in San Francisco" by San Francisco Magazine in 2015, the Social Study did not disappoint! 

I really liked the atmosphere. It was like a mini library with books on atop cushy walls which had seats hanging off of them (see picture.) I loved reaching up to read books and looking at all of the titles. 

There were people working on laptops there at 9pm on a Sunday night, and I was surprised to see quite a few groups of people in there so late on a Sunday--I was worried it would be empty, but that was not the case! 

The drinks were alright. It seemed like a limited selection. 

My main gripe was that the seats along the cushioned padded wall were too high for me! I had trouble getting comfortable.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
First time trying a "beertail" (cocktails made with beer) and it was awesome! I had the Fillmore Shandy made with Scrimshaw Pilsner, house-made ginger syrup, and citrus. It was light, refreshing and I highly recommend it. Their menu also has "Karatetails", beer, sake, wine and some light bites. 

This bar has a hipster ambiance decorated with books and art on the walls. They also had a movie playing on their wall as well as some games available like "Uno" and "Apples to Apples". We came on a Friday night and there was a DJ who started playing at 8pm. Overall a cool and chill bar.
author: Susan D.

description:
You can study here, like actually study with a cup of coffee and free WiFi that is decently fast. 

You can also drink a glass of wine or two while enjoying the ambiance and working on a side project or two. 

At night, this place becomes a club. Go figure! Love the spot :)
author: Jenée S.

description:
I found this Cool place to chill out with wine/beer/cocktails or coffee! I wish there were more cafes/social places like this in town! 

They have a nice menu of alcoholic drinks too 

My only suggestion is that they should spend more into the upkeep of this place (ie. replace chairs with ruined cushion seats?)
author: Kelly L.

description:
It's sad when diversity and culture gets wiped out of a district like the Fillmore. It's even sadder when rich folks pat themselves on the back for pretending they've brought it back with a snooty establishment devoid of any heart whatsoever. 

Let me explain. First, my cappuccino was terrible. The bartender looked like he was going to have a temper tantrum when I ordered it too. I think he just didn't want to turn the machine on. He also tried to charge me for my date's drink, even though I said we were paying separately, twice. And it wasn't loud in there at the time. I took it as a subtle way of letting me know my date was out of my league/income bracket. None of the bartender's business, really. And why would he try and charge me for both of our drinks? 

Because that's what the SF service industry has become. Kiss up to the rich, save the good stuff for them, and treat everyone else like crap/make their food and drinks taste like crap (like in Black Mirror, Nosedive, when she orders a brushed suede or whatever). And, while I'm down with the diverse literature on the shelves, and the Black Lives Matter and jazz posters, it comes off as kinda fake when you consider how the bartenders treat lower income artists like me- much worse than someone like my date, who apparently exuded that woke/wealthy/well-read vibe that is the essential combination for getting good service here. His online profile seemed much more down to earth. I thought this place would be too.
author: Shaina R.

description: Love this place! Went based on yelp reviews and enjoyed everything about it but mostly the extremely friendly bartender!
author: Mary T.

description:
If I could give this place no stars I would. I came into the bar hoping to grab a drink and walked out insulted by the staff. The bartenders are so snooty here and they make it a point to put you down. My friend asked for a Moscow Mule and the bartender said "You walked into a fancy wine bar so you really think we serve that shit?" The other bartenders snickered. What the hell? You do not need to be a prick to say you don't serve or make that at your bar. My friend then ordered an IPA at this "fancy wine bar" and I was so shocked I didn't even bother ordering. Safe to say, I'm never coming back. 

Don't come here - the bartenders are here to insult you. 

ALSO, what the hell is up with the ceiling? The sound proofing tiles are on the verge of falling off and landing on patrons.

Update: they kicked everyone out before closing. It's 12:44 AM and the bar closes at 1. The bartender is so rude. He was cleaning and flipping over chairs and almost hit my friend in the head. We get it, you're done for the night but no need to put customers in danger.
author: Sun S.

description: Came in for a quick drink before a movie. Awesome happy hour specials. Their vegetarian tacos (potato) are amazing! Glad I dropped in.
author: Dominique G.

description:
This place is super super cute! I love the theme and the vibes are great. They have little couches and chairs as well as tables. I love that they play a mix of music and have DJs often. We went on a Wednesday and it was half price bottles so we got a bottle of bubbles. It paired perfectly well with the charcuterie board. They have a great selection of "winetails", "beertails". They don't have liquor so it is only beer and wine, just be aware of that. 

I don't think this would be a great place for a huge party but definitely great for a small group of like 4 or 6. It is definitely a great place to stop by and have a drink before a show at The Fillmore.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
One of our favorite cousins use to work here. During our last outing to the City, we decided to stop in for a drink and hang out. I instantly fell in love when I spotted the Prince shrine behind the bar. How appropriate. I love Prince. There was even a poster in the bathroom. For just those reasons, Social Study gets 5 stars from me. 
I will also say, they serve up the best white sangria I've had and the cup that my friend had her tea in was tops! We also tried some warm chocolate cookies that were amazing. We will be back next time we visit!
author: Jaime C.

description: I have been here in the past a couple of times alone and with friends and it was cool.  However, I was in today and service has gone downhill considerably.  Staff is non responsive and less than basic.  I had to ask for the Wi-Fi password and was given the wrong one.  I was also asked to literally help the staff bus part of the bar counter amd after I did it, I didn't receive a basic "thank you"!  After overpaying for a small scrappy glass of wine and being treated like a second class citizen, I gladly left and will not be back unless there is a major change in service.  It's a shame because it is close to me and used to be convenient.  I'll be sure to update my friends who started going on my recommendation about the failure of this place.
author: Vanessa B.

description:
You know what I love? A solid bar within walking distance, not too crowded or hip, with a drink selection that a) tastes good and b) doesn't leave you completely broke by the end of the evening. 

The Social Study delivers on pretty much everything here. It's a little off my usual way down Fillmore, so it wasn't until recently that I discovered this little place. It's book store themed, but not all the way styled through, more like it would look like in a book nerd's living room. It's great to catch up with a friend, because the music still allows you to have a conversation or just enjoy an after work drink before heading home. Prices for a bottled beer were somewhere in the $5-$8 range, a dollar off during happy hour. A few bites are also available, although I didn't get to try any of those during my recent visit. I had a great time here and will definitely return!
author: Katja S.

description:
Nice ambiance. Noise level is high, but not so high that your ears will ring the next day. 
Staff is attentive and this place doesn't tend to get crowded. 
Does not pass the "good for first date place" test: 
-Only serves beer or wine.
-only ONE bathroom. Total. Not per gender.
-And slightly out of the way/odd location.
Street gives off "make sure you're walked to your car afterward" kind of vibes.
author: Paulina C.

description: This tiny little bar is what I view as a typical sf nerdy hipster bar. Its a combo of a coffee shop/bar with a library/nerdy theme. I personally like the theme and the way it looks but if thats not your vibe I could see where people might not enjoy it. It is a pretty small spot so don't come here with a large group. Better for small crowds. The drinks were solid here and the service was friendly and fast. They do have food/bar snacks but during my visit only got some drinks which were good.
author: Peter P.

description:
Came here for a happy hour with a friend, and was pleasantly surprised with the relaxing ambiance that proved conducive for great conversations and drinks. 

We each had a glass of their sangria ($6) during happy hour; I had a glass of their house white ($7) and my friend had one of their draft beers ($6). Their sangria was tasty! Filled with fruit, and stronger than you think. This is a small place, so probably good for groups of 2-4- more intimate gatherings. 

Overall, would return if in the area for a relaxing happy hour with a close friend! :)
author: Robin Y.

description: I really enjoyed the vibes of this bar/cafe! Small, quirky, r&b/hip hop playlist playing in the background, Space Jam on the projector, wine&beer... who can complain? I split a fancy bottle of wine with my date. The bar was happening on a Sunday night but not too loud where we had to yell to have a conversation. I would recommend this bar to anyone who is in the area!
author: Marcie A.

description:
While no actual hard liquor is served here, don't let that taint your view of The Social Study's standing as a bar-- the day to night concept is definitely rocking here.

Came with a group of friends on a weekday evening. The place was fairly busy, given the time and day, but we were able to co-opt a long table for the five of us.

I've scoured the menu but can't find the name of the drink I got. It was a winetail though, and while it wasn't the best drink I ever had, it had the ability to get you drunk without even realizing. For wine, it was potent af. Of all the winetails/karatetails my group tried that evening, it was by far the collective favorite of our group.

All in all, a nice place to chill before a dinner or show. I can only imagine how great it would be to do the transition day to night-- getting s**t cranked out and then having friends show up for the after-work party.
author: Angela C.

description: Great place to come hang out. There's not the MOST seating in the world but the past few times I've gone, I haven't had issues sitting down. They have an impressive and unique drink selection, fusing cocktails into beer, wine, and sake. They offer small plates to eat, yet I haven't ordered one yet. I love the fact that I can come here and get a tea or coffee while my friends can get beer or wine. The service is friendly and efficient, and they reserve a spot at the bar that's only for ordering drinks, so you're not standing around for 20 minutes trying to get the bartender to notice you. The aesthetic is something I also have to comment on. Very fitting! It's lined with books and globes, to match the theme of a place to study. It's awesome and it's in a good spot where you don't see a lot of criminal activity going on outside. Breath of fresh air. Keep it up!
author: Elizabeth G.

description: I love the vibe of Social Study. My roommate and I decided to grab a drink one Thursday evening and headed straight to the Social Study. We were able to grab a small table and easily ordered drinks at the bar. My cocktail was refreshing and delicious!
author: Sarah B.

description: Super chill vibe, not crowded, great wine / beer / soju cocktail selection. We came in on a Sat night and the DJs (apparently rotate in once a month) was awesome- played funky soulful lounge-ish music. I'd definitely come back, maybe while the kitchen and/or espresso bar is open (1-9:30pm) for some milk n' cookies :)
author: erin d.

description: I like the idea of this place, but it could use better interior decorating and of quality.
author: Yana N.

description:
Cafe or bar? Both! I've been during daytime and ordered coffee while the hubs studied and I read for pleasure. And I've been @ night for meet ups and to support our local DJ's and ordered alchy dranks. The ambiance is always chill. Even when it's crowded, it's still manageable. Folks don't get obnoxious in here, at least not times that I've been there. So, for that I like. 
Also, during a meet up w/ a gf, we ordered food. And from what I remember it was decent-good. And drinks were good... not weak not overwhelmingly strong. Just right, just right.
author: Roxane P.

description:
When looking for a spot to grab a drink and a bite before a show at The Fillmore, we happened upon The Social Study.  It's a really cute spot and if I were a local, I'd probably hang out here quite a bit.  The menu, the ambiance, the dj's (in a wood and glass booth that evokes a dreamy academic space)... it's all very quirky and only a teeny bit precocious.  The food was good--my partner had a Ruben that had an unexpected wasabi kick, and I enjoyed the Cuban sliders.  I did wish they had come with sides instead the tiniest pickle bite but as far as lounge food goes, it was fine.  Our cocktails were especially tasty--I definitely recommend 'The Crane' if you're looking for something refreshing and just a bit different.  The service was also really good--friendly and helpful without being overbearing in the least.  

I couldn't give it 5 stars though... there are minor faults to this place, which mostly revolve around the seating.  I'm not exactly a dainty flower, so the tiny little fold out ledges on the wall did not inspire confidence as a seating option.  And the menu online isn't up to date so I was left longing for options that weren't actually offered.  These are really minor faults though, so don't let it stop you from dropping in!
author: Lorean W.

description:
The Social Study is a great place to catch up with friends, get to know someone, or even do some work with a glass of wine! My friends and I particularly enjoyed the candle lit ambiance and great music choice! The room isn't huge, but there's a lot of seats and tables (mostly seating 2 people, but 2 long wooden tables for 6+)

They're a little limited on their selection of beer on tap but they have a bigger range of bottled beers, wine, and mixed drinks. 

I'd definitely be returning here whenever I'm craving a quick bite with a friend!
author: Mako U.

description: Coffee shop where you can study by day, and bar with poppin' music and dope cocktails by night. This is the Fillmore superhero we never knew we needed.
author: Farrah N.

description:
My friend and I were looking for somewhere to sit and kill time before opening at a nearby restaurant. We initially planned on hanging out at Boba Guys and stopped short when we saw a pretty big line just to get inside. Yeah, that wasn't going to work. 

Even though my friend is not a huge drinker, I convinced her to go to Social Study nearby- I knew at the very least from Yelp reviews that I would definitely drink, but that there were also non-alcoholic drinks (coffee, tea, etc.) available. We walked in and I was immediately charmed- there were tables along the wall with these boards that could be folded down for seats, although I did notice that sitting on them... I could feel myself sliding down. We moved over to a regular table when we had the chance. 

It's such a casual place and I'm a huge fan of it. Everybody was chill and I definitely didn't feel self-conscious (sometimes I do if I feel underdressed). Plenty of people were either just hanging out or on their laptops. The bartender was really cool - gave me some recommendations when I asked. Drinks were affordable (especially for SF)- I ordered a couple of drinks that I immensely enjoyed, including the michelada. My friend found a beer that she has enjoyed in the UK. Loved that they had beertails, winetails, and "karatetails".

This was a really nice find, if I'd definitely go again. 5/5.
author: Elodie T.

description:
Great date night or intimate group hangout spot. 

Drink wise: they have a nice selection of winetails, beertails, karatetails drinks. I liked the karatetails selection. Yummy drinks. 

Food wise: we tried the veg and chicken sandwiches which were great. Felt very home made and healthy. Good grain bread and decent portion sizes to serve as a pre-dinner snack maybe. The bread pudding was AMAZING!!! Perfect amount of sweetness served with a side of whipped cream. It's delicious! 

Vibe: the vibe in this place is the best. True to their name they have a lot of books everywhere. I guess you could come in here, get a drink, read a few chapters of a novel by Charles dickens and just chill. The music was also amazing - lots of jazz/electro kind of tunes on a Friday evening. The decor of this place is super cute! 

Definitely going back here someday. Maybe for a drink and snack before a show at BoomBoom room!
author: Soundarya C.

description:
My new favorite casual bar/cafe! I LOVE this place. I came here after dinner with friends and loved the music the DJ was playing (kind of indie, techno-y, but chill) and the ambiance. The bar really reminds me of SoMa, with its exposed brick walls and industrial but cozy feel.

Drinks are solid and it's just a great place to relax and chill with friends. I also love the school theme going on with a library of books and the menu following the academia theme as well (after school snacks, so cute).

Apparently people come here to study/work on their laptop at 10 pm, haha.
author: Janet H.

description: There's always excellent music, food and vibes whenever I come here. The social Study is one of my favorite spots to kick it in the Fillmore fasho!
author: Sandra T.

description: The ambiance of this place is spot on. Dark, mysterious, the books add a cool vibe to the decor. I appreciated the art work and the political messages that were portrayed. The drinks are creative. I tried the yellow diamond and the crane. Both were neither particularly strong - so good for light drinkers. I prefer strong drinks myself, so prob go for non mixed drinks next time.
author: Linda H.

description:
Setting and ambiance was excellent.  Service was also great. 

Giving 3 Stars because the bartender pulled something kinda shady:

Ended up ordering 4 glasses of wine.  Had a taste of my second wine choice before a full pour

When I closed out, I was handed the iPad, ready to sign, - $56.00 charge, $17.00 tip and no visible way to edit the tip amount.  As I was on a date, I felt social pressure to just sign and go.  My choice, for sure. I certainly COULD have brought this up, but it seems like he was taking advantage of my not wanting to look cheap.

There's definitely no way I would have opted into a 30% tip for maybe 4 minutes of interaction with the bartender.  

So yeah.  This did not sit well with me, and I don't see myself returning anytime soon.
author: David M.

description: This place has a great vibe. Skater meets library meets bar with dj. If you are looking for a quick drink or a date- this is a great place. Weekends is a bit loud but on weekdays you can hear everyone clearly. Pretty small so that great for crowds but there are two window sections for about 6-8 people.
author: Tina L.

description: Really enjoyed early drinks here. I got the happy hour sangria and my husband had a few beers. We also got the cheese platter. The cheese was just ok but the games they have really made the place fun. We were able to entertain ourselves for 2.5 hours playing trivial pursuit. Great atmosphere, very relaxed and not too loud. A great stop before a night out.
author: Alice W.

description:
A lively, dynamic venue that really lives up to its name. It's more of a cafe during the day where you can order both caffeinated and boozy drinks, and where there are quite a few people camped out at communal tables working on their laptops. As things shift into the late afternoon and early evening hours, the vibe becomes even more social as the day-workers give way to a nighttime bar vibe. 

There's a huge variety of beers and wines to choose from, and they even make creative beertails, winetails, and "karatetails." Overall, the atmosphere is open and friendly, and the bartender on duty when I was last here was quite engaging and helpful.

A great neighborhood venue anytime of day, and one that's convenient enough (near the corner of Geary and Fillmore) to make it worth taking Muni from anywhere else in the city.
author: Vincent L.

description: I hate to be the Debbie downer, but this was my local bar for a long time and I absolutely hated it. Despite all it's quirks which should make it a fun place to hang out (board games, books, movies projected on the wall), the reality is that it's the most uncomfortable place to spend any amount of time in, ever. I have no idea why it was voted a good date spot - would you like to sit at a communal table for your date? Or one of the many insanely uncomfortable pull down seats against the wall that you can only get one ass cheek on? How about not being able to hear your date over the loudest hip hop/gangsta rap music ever? I've wasted way too many nights with friends here trying to yell our conversations at each other over the DJ pumping ear achingly loud music into an empty bar, while we down our drinks as fast as possible just to get the hell out of there. The place is so cold I would never leisurely sit down with any of those books and stay for any amount of time. Plus one star because the menu is ok. I enjoyed my beer, and a friend got milk and warm cookies once. The bartenders are nice, despite making you repeat your drink order a minimum of 3 times because no one can hear anyone over the music. But now that I don't live near The Social Study, I won't miss the place at all.
author: Kelli C.

description:
Oh my goodness gracious. I am in LOVE with this place. I don't know why, but I think it's because it's just the perfect mix for everything I love about going out.

Think your average coffeehouse that you go to lounge in, catch up with a friend or go do some work... But instead of just espresso and small bites, they offer wine and beer and some tasty happy hour bites (tacos, sandwiches, cheese charcuterie plates). Inspiring! And to add to that? They've got an awesome lounge-like space full with blue cushion seating along the walls, music playing, a movie projecting onto a brick wall, awesome local board art hung up and a library of what looks like to be vinyl records on top. DIG IT!

The vibe, the ambiance, the clientele... It's amazing. I came here to stop for a bite and a drink with my brother before seeing a show at the Fillmore earlier this week and enjoyed my time here. The place typically attracts a younger, trendy SF millennial crowd (albeit I was the baby in there), but I love it.

I ordered the SANFRANGIA: a beautiful red wine concoction with fresh seasonal fruit swimming and bathing around. Went down like summer in my body. Can't go wrong! (I miss my heavy beer, but when you're trying to go dry, this lightens the load! And lightens you up well!) $5 for happy hour from 5-7pm. (Their 3 small tacos for happy hour were just okay, according to my brother, but they were affordable anyhow!)

Order to the barista-bartender, who also delivers your food to you, and enjoy the night! If only I were a local, I'd love to drop by again!
author: Rachel Ann C.

description:
Love the vibes from afternoon coffee to late night drinks. One of my favorite night spots in the city, and the epitome of a "study date" location. 

I recommend the Buzz Kill (Guinness with a shot of expresso)  and Wrong Island (Alakey soju, Carpano Antica vermouth, Lillet Blanc, Agave wine, lemon & lime juice, coke). Their study snacks are pretty great as well- check out the Three Amigos Tacos!
author: Victoria L.

description:
I'm really glad my friend found this place when the Boba Guys around the corner was way too crowded one Sunday afternoon. We killed some time here before dinner. There's a really nice low-key, non-pretentious and not too hipstery vibe going on, haha. It's hard to find that balance I think, and the Social Study does it so effortlessly.

This is a comfortable place to do a list of things, whether it's reading/writing, laptop working, catching up with a friend, people watching. There wasn't a predominant "type" of person here doing one thing, it was a nice mix of things going on. This is also reflected in the menu, which includes various alcoholic drinks (cocktails, beer, wine, etc.) and various tea and coffee. All the drinks were very surprisingly reasonably priced so that's another major plus! How do they do it?? The bartender was also friendly and easy going, adding to the notable experience! 

We didn't have trouble snagging a couple of seats, but this place does get pretty crowded and with that, an increase in chatter through later in the afternoon, although I still saw people reading and on their laptops through the noise. There was also steady music playing and a projector against the wall, but they weren't too distracting for me.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Came here after getting ramen at Yamadaya. This place is super cool with a lot of fusion cocktails I've never seen before. They also serve sake, which is expected for pretty much being in Japantown.

They have cool skateboards and a ton of books all over the walls as decoration. There's also these cool seats that fold out of this sofa looking wall that are grouped in pairs with a cute tiny table in between each one, so there were a good amount of couples on steamy dates near me.

Price-wise, it's pretty normal for sf to pay more than $10 for a cocktail. I think the beers weren't outrageous either, something like $7 per beer?

I find it funny that there were actually people there still studying at night when it clearly became a bar at night. I like it and think it's quirky but omg some people do not lower their laptop's screen brightness. The rest of the bar is pretty dark, so blinding light coming from people's laptops was kind of annoying.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Decided to try out a new bar in JTown and a friend recommend giving this place a try. The bar was a little dark and loud with the live DJ but everyone seemed to be having fun. They were playing a mix of old school and newer hip hop and R&B and I'm a sucker for that.

The bar only serves beer, wine, and sake so if you want hard liquor this isn't the place. We ordered a few beers, sangria, and a lemon drink. The beers were nice and cold, the sangria had a good taste to it but seemed a little watered down, but the lemon drink was just right.

We tried to order food but the kitchen was closed so we had to continue our food adventure elsewhere.

They also had seating and space for people to play card games and board games, all provided by the bar which is a great touch.

May visit again for another relaxing night of drinks, music, and games.
author: Camera P.

description:
This place is awesome. I'm from Baltimore and have spent lots of time working remotely in SF lately, where I have found that free WiFi can be a real challenge. It looks rather inconspicuous from the outside but this is easily my favorite place I've found.

I sat at the bar where there was room to plug in (didn't see outlets along the blue wall) and the atmosphere was super chill and relaxing. Music was kind of loud but I liked everything the bartender played so that didn't phase me since WiFi was working well. Loved the decor and stayed long enough to switch from coffee to beer and still felt comfortable and welcome. 

Sidenote: I almost never order salad anywhere but I had the mixed greens salad and it was SO. GOOD. Will definitely be back again ASAP!
author: Gabrielle W.

description:
The interior design here is so cute! There are textbooks along the upper shelves for that studying vibe and the quilted side seating area is so classy! I don't know about the practicality of the side seats though because they seem tiny and I am almost certain that even a slightly overweight person would not be able to fit on them.. 

I came here on a hot summer day, which is probably my main reason for the lower rating. If you've been in this place (or anywhere in SF I guess), you would know that it is small and cramped! It was stuffy and hot and I saw a few flies just flying all slowly like they were also lethargic from the heat .. Just unexpected, I guess. 

I ordered the BBQ sliders at a non-happy hour time and they were soooo small. Like smaller than those Hawaiian buns you get at the grocery store. The taste was not bad, but I was disappointed by the size:price ratio. The sangria was very refreshing and enjoyable as was the ginger limeade. 

I would probably not come back in the summer but I could see this being an ok place to catch up with friends some other time if no one is hungry.
author: Diana W.

description: This is a really cool place with a lot of networking events for women on mondays at 8pm... I forget which mondays. Great drinks, too!
author: Katherine G.

description:
Personally, when the stressors of school, work, and life get me down, I grab a drink. The Social Study HH definitely made me happy, relaxed, chill, ready to take on the world, etc. I came in after a tiring shift of my internship and work in desperate need of a sangria. Thankfully, my friends showed me this cool spot, located in Japantown. 

They say, your vibe attracts your tribe, and I was surrounded by good vibes and company. This is a spot that I will continuously visit because of their classy, elite-looking interior and 90's jams. Drinks are dangerously inexpensive with varied selections from beers, wine, cocktails. They also serve bar snacks and cheese plates, if you're really feeling fancy.
author: Rachelle Y.

description: Unforgivably dated trivia pursuit and the charcuterie board was underwhelming and expensive.  But nice place to chat and have a drink.  Friendly staff and warm environs
author: Mike J.

description:
Originally wanted to come here to study with my friend but ended up just getting an evening drink LOL. The place has a great vibe: books line the shelves, the brick wall on one side gives it a sort of old rustic feel, and the music is on point (a lot of 90s pop, hip hop, and r&b, as well as some less annoying modern tunes). It's a nice spot to grab a drink and chill with friends, but definitely better suited for groups of 2 or 4 based on how the seating is arranged. 

My friend and I ordered the Chocolate Factory and Buzzkill, both of which include Guinness stouts. I really liked the first drink, especially when I saw the bartender grab a pound of Trader Joe's chocolate and grate the chocolate straight on top of the drink. It wasn't too sweet and the stout added a smooth flavor that wasn't overpowering. With the Buzzkill, I instantly smelled the bitter espresso but the Guinness definitely balanced out that flavor to be quite enjoyable. Both drinks were $9 each, and the Buzzkill actually came in a tall glass so we got our money's worth - however you probably won't get turnt off of this LOL.

The storefront is pretty plain and inside isn't very spacious, but hopefully it'll stay lowkey and not get too popular because I don't want it to get crowded lmao. Prices are reasonable for drinks but I have yet to try the food :( With happy hour every weekday, you can bet I'll be back soon!
author: KC W.

description:
I'm sure you put the "stud" in "study" but don't come here to do work. Like really. 

Popped in here with a friend before going to dinner. We had an hour to kill and decided to check it out. It was fairly packed for a Thursday night, and had standing room only. That didn't deter us. We hung out for a bit, jammed to some dope  R&B beats, and caught up on the teeny tiny corner bench that opened up about 30 mins before we left. 

The ambiance in here is cozy, inviting, and trendy. Everything from the brick wall, movie playing, cute wall seating, near ceiling DJ booth, and leather bound books makes The Social Study waaaay cool!  It brings in lots of great people watching. If you're lucky enough to snag a seat you'll enjoy your stay. The menu has a lot to offer.  We didn't try any food since we were headed to State Bird, but what was was brought out to those around us looked delish. 

Good vibes. I'll be back!
author: Shereen A.

description: Crap wine bar. I guess that's what happens when you go further than Sutter street. The bartender was awful. She was so into some stupid dude at the bar that she ignored her only 4 tables. Whenever we asked for more wine, water or a plate....she was clearly annoyed. I could go on and on and on and on about the shitty wine bar. It's clearly not Pacific Heights wine bar is clearly A lower Pacific Heights wine bar. I would never suggest anyone going to this wine bar. It has potential but the bartender is her horrendous. Don't waste your time.
author: Amy D.

description:
A chill, almost hidden spot on busy Geary Boulevard, the Social Study draws one in to relax alone or meet friends. The ambiance is of your friend's cool older brother's room. He may collect the vinyl and skateboards which adorn the walls.

Two benches on either side of the entrance, a bar on the left (where one orders food and drink) in addition to communal tables, suspended stools and tabletops attached to the wall make up the seating. Look up and one could see the DJ, perhaps that older brother.

I ordered the house made limeade which was great, and no food, since I'd recently eaten. A variety of snacks, cheese plate, sandwiches, salads, coffee and a great cocktail and wine list are offered. I'll return to try their house made food items and suggest you visit when in the area.
author: Carol W.

description:
The bar looks like it would be a fantastic place to have a nice drink, but with the snooty rude staff think again.

I experienced extremely rude service from both of the female bartenders. Both had dark curly hair (Thursday 12th April at around 3:30 / 4:00 pm). The first bartender demanded payment from me whilst I was on my phone finishing a work call. I understand I have to open a tab or pay for the drink, but please don't interrupt a phone call without even saying 'excuse me' or 'pardon', she just yelled at me and demanded I pay while I was on the call.

The second bartender placed a candle under my laptop screen as it was open, seriously? When I moved it she gave me attitude saying it wasn't near my laptop, would she like to replace the screen? Also, her appearance was pretty unappealing for someone to serve food and drinks. She looked greasy and her clothes were filthy.

I wish I could give this post 0/5 stars, but have to give it a 1. I think the owner needs to have a second look at her/his staff as having those unappealing rude employees with attitude problems represent your business is not good practice.
author: Honest R.

description:
Super cute cozy place. 

We came in before going to the movies and it was perfect. We made it in time for happy hour and found 2 seats. The house white, house red, and sangria were surprisingly good for house and happy hour options. The tacos were average and that's because we're spoiled by all those amazing taquerias in the city. The sliders were delicious!  

It seems like a place a lot of locals go to because people were running into each other and the bartender seemed familiar with them. A couple people were doing work on their laptops. But it seems like a good date spot. The seats by the wall are high up and don't have a foot rest for short people. 

Love the exposed brick and glass room above for DJs.
author: A. P.

description:
Adorable little spot. I would totally come here with a group, or even alone to get a little studying done, date night or simply relax. The food was great- ordered the house made chicken salad. Would have like to have known it was going to be spicy though... not a problem, just wasn't expecting it. Also got the passion fruit ale- YUM! Would love to come back and try some of their other signature items, like the Sanfrangria. 

My only complaint is that the wall seating was terribly uncomfortable. I am a relatively small girl and I felt like I barely fit on the seats, plus they were so hard my legs/feet fell asleep from being squished and hanging off of it. 

Other than that I loved the ambiance, books along the shelves and cushioned walls. It was pretty busy for a Tuesday night and I certainly saw all kinds of groups- study group, date night, and girls night out. Would definitely recommend this place, and I will certainly be back!
author: Angelina L.

description:
This is easily my absolute favorite bar in San Francisco. Why? Because it has a killer ambiance (chic and cozy library vibes with brick walls and a projector projecting old films on the wall), friendly bartenders/baristas, unique cocktails focusing on wine or beer, and best of all - doubles as both a study spot during the day and a bar at night. 

During the day, it is brightly lit and a great spot to come and get some work done (they have free WiFi), while sipping on carefully brewed Four Barrel coffee. As the evening rolls around, the lights get dimmer, and the loungey/R&B music starts to play, converting the space into a happening spot for friends to convene or for great dates to happen :). 

I love their unique spin on cocktails that are categorized as either winetails, beertails, or soju cocktails (karatetails). From their winetails, I recommend the Little Apple - delicious taste! For beertails, the Chocolate Factory is decadent. For a karatetail, order The Crane! It's refreshing and definitely gingery, from their house-made ginger syrup :). I have yet to order from their wine list, but will do so soon!

Go go go here, daytime or nighttime!
author: Sabina S.

description:
This place is a bar with a cafe. Its a pretty good place to socialize because the prices are not that expensive and the drinks here are pretty good.
The study side might be a bit harder to do here obviously because of the bar and loud music. When they place jazzy music its actually a really good place to just read a book and relax with a cup or tea. I got the chai tea latte and its a bit more gingery than other places so be weary of that! Its still pretty good! 
Not a 5 star because as a student im looking for a nice place to study but a bit harder with the loud ambience. There are a lot of people  here though that are studying. 
Theres free wifi which is nice, but no outlets. The tables are a bit low for its a little uncomfortable. However, I like this cafe and will probably be back later again when I'm in the Fillmore District!
author: Joshua B.

description:
Cute little spot that has coffee, tea, wine, beer, and a few "study snacks"- small plates and appetizers. You can sit at their bar or at tables and while it doesn't seem like the sitting is ideal for groups, it's a great spot for coming to yourself or with one or two others. 

I do wish their menu was a little more extensive but the one thing I tried, the pork sliders, were really delicious and honestly a lot better than expected. They were nicely cooked, the sauce was tasty, and the bread was perfect. Definitely would get these again. Also had a glass of sangria which was pretty good and a really nice glass of their Zinfandel. 

I would be back if I was in the area or wanted a chill place to hang out at or even do a little work. Not a place I would go out of my way to visit but it was a nice spot.
author: Seema U.

description:
LOVVEEE this place.  However disclaimer: definitely not the place for everyone.

Music Vibe: When we came on a random week night, there was actually a DJ playing on the second floor. FYI the layout is pretty clever as seen in the photos.  He was playing a mix of hip hop, future, etc. basically just up and coming songs that were not every day radio music, which I appreciated.

Space Vibe: The place is pretty small, with 2-3 tables fit for groups of 4 or more and side wall seating for plenty of seats for two.  However there was a decent bar space and plenty of space in the middle for standing.  What I love about this place is its a great weekday night or weekend afternoon place to hang out with some buddies, have a nice date, and just keep things lowkey, where people are composed and not outrageous drunk frat stars.

Drink Vibe: note that this is a wine bar so the "hardest" thing they serve is sake or soju.  They definitely had a great selection of wines and had some pretty amazing sake cocktails which I would totally go back for.

Food: This place does serve food, but did not get a chance to try any so my review is not contingent on the taste of the food served or the selection of food.

TLDR: lowkey vibe with some future/upcoming music.  The drinks are well made, but it is only a wine bar so no hard alcohol (but they do have sake cocktails, great for date spots or lowkey weekday drinks.
author: Ryan G.

description:
Xoxo to Social Study!

Dimly lit spot that is hidden from main view and I love the charm that this mini bar with seating exudes.

They serve up swanky cocktail drinks, wine and beer.  The sidekick was well named because it came with a beer and a side of sake shot.  Surely, a complementary sidekick.

Interesting part about this place is that one can bring their workload or if you're a bookworm and thirsty while at it, it can be brought here to commit to.  Getting your drink on to release the anxiety or release for relaxation, is the best form of therapy - especially while trying to tone down the workload or up the imagination in a book. 

Cheers to some socializing and to some studying!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I think I would like this bar a lot more earlier in the day.. I wasn't really having it when me and my two girlfriends walked in around 9pm on a Friday night and felt like we were entering a club. The music was way too loud for us to talk normally instead of shouting (Origin is just right around the corner if I wanted to do that...) so I think we left a little earlier than we would have liked to.

I really like the decor and space of this bar. It's a small, casual spot and it almost feels like it could be someone's room. The "DJ" spot is in this separate room that you can see as you look up towards the ceiling, and there's a cushioned wall with a ton of books on top that have two-person tables and seats that fold in and out of the wall.

They have some really good fruity craft cocktails here and a decent selection of wine, but when I came I had the Rekorderlig passionfruit cider! I was actually reallly surprised that a bar in SF serves it as I've only seen and had it internationally, but it's one of my favorites! The bartender suggested I have it with some lemon, so i took his advice and it went really well with the drink. I wouldn't mind coming here for coffee sometime and enjoying the atmosphere then!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
I like The Social Study.  It kind of reminds me of Central Perk from Friends by the decor of the place.  Very hip and relaxing atmosphere where you can enjoy some Four Barrel Coffee or have a few cocktails and bar bites to pass the time.

Their cocktails menu categorized into Winetails, Beertails, and Karatetails which drinks are named in reference to The Karate Kid.  If a place has drinks called Sweep The Leg and Kobra Kai, I'm already a fan!

Of course I went with the Sweep The Leg which has Alakey Soju, thyme, cucumber, lemon, pineapple.  It's a very refreshing drink to have and thankfully there was no need to put me in a body bag after finishing it.

Another time I came here I had the a Spicy Coke from their Winetails.  It's a very interesting mix made up of Port, Four Barrel Espresso, lemon, cane cola.  

I didn't have a chance to try any of the food but next time I go there I would love to their their Roast Pork  Mini Tacos and BLT Bites.  They sound really good and would probably pair well with any over their cocktails.

If parking was easier in the area during the day, I'd probably visit Social Study more often, but at least at night it's a lot easier to park nearby.  It's cool spot to hangout and I highly recommend stopping by here if you're waiting for a table at any of the restaurants nearby like Dosa, Izakaya Kou, or State Bird Provisions.
author: Rodney H.

description:
I came here during the afternoon so it's probably a completely different scene in the evening. There was only a few people inside and the service was very nice. It was a chill atmosphere for hanging out, reading, or studying. There's also books, board games, and cards lying around.

They serve a variety of snacks, food, and drinks. I got the ginger limeade ($3.50). It was very tart and refreshing. I would definitely come back here to get some work done!
author: Linda X.

description:
I love the vibe of Social Study. Very laid back with good music. I met up with some girlfriends for happy hour on Thursday, November 19th a little before 6pm. We had some drinks and snacks.

*Cabernet sauvignon, rancho sisquoc 2010: Santa Barbara county, california ($12 glass)
*Cabernet, syrah blend, big guy: Yountville, california ($11 glass)

I'm a bold, full bodied red kind of girl, so I randomly picked the cab. It was good, but our bartender Ryan suggested I try the Big Guy. This was definitely more my style. I liked it better than the cab.

I didn't try any, but we also ordered the Classic potato skins: Idaho russets, cheddar cheese, rosemary / brown sugar rubbed bacon, sour cream, scallions ($9). The order came with three potato skins and my gfs seemed to enjoy them.

I didn't try any of their HH specials, but I believe they have one red wine, one white and sangria on it. I think their HH ends at 7pm, so my gfs had plenty time to take advantage of it.

There wasn't a DJ the night we went, but I'd be interested in coming back when there is. I really enjoyed the lax vibe. And it wasn't too crowded which is always a plus!
author: Elena N.

description: This is a trendy little place and obviously a very good date spot. However, their food options leave something to be desired. There was some appetizer place featuring apple, nuts, and olives. Literally three ketchup-sized cups, you know those tiny condiment cups, on with about an 1/8 an apple, one with 12 olives, on with 20 nuts. What the heck?? It was about $1 worth of food not 9 or 12 or whatever they charged for their cheekily named platter. I also ordered a side of avocado that never came. For the non-drinking, caffeine-intolerant person like me, they have decaf green tea. Close to Boom Boom Room! ayy
author: Piper N.

description: The bartender seems to have a hearing problem or sth. We asked for one drink and he made only one, then he blamed my friend for not saying it well. And the chocolate beer? It looked good in the pictures but ew... don't recommend it.
author: Hyun Ji O.

description:
Cute place. Not a ton of seating, but wasn't too crowded in a Thursday. And had tables for sharing. 

Happy hour $1 off beers, $5.5 BBQ sliders and $6 carnitas tacos. 5-7 m-f. 

The sliders were great. Good sauce and meat. Yummy bun - almost like a Hawaiian bun. 

The carnitas tacos wee also good. With avocado and cotija. Could have been a bit more moist. 

Cheese plate was good. Standard. 

Only 5 beers on tap, but it was a good selection. 

They also had a bunch of wines and non alcoholic beverages too - soda, tea, coffee, lemonade. 

Very hipster. A little louder than my preference, but not bad. 

Apparently there is a taco Tuesday - $10 for a beer and 3 tacos. Want to do that.
author: Sarah C.

description:
A really good place to get drinks and some light dinner before going to a concert at The Fillmore! The interior is nicely decorated and gives the place a really nice vibe. The food we ordered was delicious as well!

Although it's called The Social Study, the music in here is a bit loud for studying, in my opinion.
author: Helen T.

description:
The third stop on my birthday tour, this was recommended to me by my friend who works in the area. And told by another friend that he loves this place. They have good tastes.

Imagine a coffee house that you go to do your work, but instead of coffee they serve beer and wine. Brilliant!

The interior is this cool, casual vibe. With intimate areas by the front, a couple tables and the coolest feature - a padded wall with some tables jutting out and you can pull the chairs out to sit at them. Pretty neat. There is also a bar, and it looks like a DJ booth.

They have a decent beer and wine selection, and offer some cocktails as well. Have to like the diversity in this cute place. So if looking for a solid drink in the area, or looking to meet up with friends, I can highly recommend The Social Study.

Note: Don't be a dick like two people who were there at the same time as us who left their jackets on one of the wall chairs while they spent an hour at the window seats.

Other Note: The bathroom is ripped straight from Charlie Murphy's Real Hollywood Stories. And a bit of Bob's Burgers.
author: Michael C.

description: We live in the neighborhood and this is our happy hour spot after work FOR SURE! Love the drinks and the ambience and music !
author: Felicia C.

description:
Mediocre wine list
Better looking beers
Limited menu
Too loud to get work/study done
Good for an after-work/ before-music night out in the Fillmore
Friendly-enough staff
author: Scott C.

description:
Love Love LOVE this place! Such a charming little spot, hidden away in a corner of San Francisco. It's perfect for studying, relaxing, socializing, hanging out with friends, or even a super casual dinner/date. The ambiance is great with good music, creative decor, and a variety of seating options. I met up here with a friend, and we enjoyed a few glasses of delicious wine and a decadent cheese platter. I'm a huge wine-and-cheese kinda girl, so this definitely hit the spot, and I enjoyed myself immensely. 

This is a great spot to visit during the afternoon and get some work done or read a good book, or a fun spot to hang out with a few friends. Absolutely loved it!
author: Laxmi K.

description: Bomb dj every other sat. Stiff dranks. Great ambiance. Books shelves are indicative of good bars
author: vince y.

description: Great wine selection, really friendly service as well. Apparently this place serves as a cafe/pastry shop in the mornings, and becomes a wine and craft beer bar at nights. Located near State Bird Provisions and the Boom Boom Room, this is a great place for dates and casual drinks for friends. Shoutout to Ronnie, he was a great ambassador on my first visit!
author: Milton W.

description: Loved the decor and music! I ordered the MICHELADA which was like a Bloody Mary with beer, and chicken tacos. My drink was spicy and so good but the tacos were mehhhhh.. I will definitely come back and try other items on the menu!
author: Sahar C.

description:
The Social Study is a cafe by day and wine bar by night, and though the interior is pretty small, it generally doesn't get too crowded. This is one of those places that I kind of don't want to review because I don't want other people to discover it and "ruin" it. And okay, the fact that it is less than 10min walking distance from my apartment is a definite plus as well.

The ambience is relaxed but sophisticated, with a "library"-style decor (hence the name). There's probably seating for 30 or so people as well as standing room around the bar area.

Drinks are classy, with a good wine selection as well as non-alcoholic options. They also have a selection of bar bites, so you can hang out for awhile without getting hungry. I unfortunately wasn't able to try the milk and cookies as they ran out -- but that's a promising sign!

Great place to hang out if you're in the Japantown/Fillmore area and looking for a low-key place to read (during the day) or catch up with a friend (evenings and nights.
author: Brittany C.

description:
This month craving is all about charcuterie and crafty cocktails.

I did a little research of where to get my craving satisfy and this happen to be near where I am going to eat for dinner. Score!

Early enough for happy hour, I got to try their charcuterie and their tasty cocktail called The Crane. Love it and I can't wait to come back.

I hope you give this place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
It's funny because one of the reviewers right before me said that she didn't want to post a Yelp review in fear that an all-star review was going to make The Social Study even more popular and draw big crowds, which would ultimately take away from the specialness of this place. My sentiments exactly! Ugh it pains me to write this but at the same time I love this bar and it deserves a billion five star reviews. Darn. 

My husband and I had our date night nearby at the Sundance Kabuki theater nearby (we saw Sausage Party which was hilaaarious, in case you were wondering). We walked for around a bit and he suggested we grab a couple of drinks at Social Study before heading home. He had been there once before with some of his friends and raved about it, so sure, why not. 

We walked in and I was ready to write a review based on the ambiance. Hello, brick wall! I have a thing for brick walls (they remind me of home) so plus 20 stars right there obviously. But in all seriousness, the ambiance is dope. Awesome music (lot of 90s hip hop and R&B- which will win me over every time), nice looking young crowd, movie projected a movie on the brick wall...ready to drink all the drinks now please!

.....and that's exactly what we did. What was supposed to just be a drink or two turned into three or four...or was it five? Don't you love those type of nights?! Well we haven't had one of those since we moved from New York so I would like to think that this alone is very telling of Social Study's vibe. We just enjoyed the atmosphere so much that the cabernet sauvs basically poured themselves and made their way over to our cozy little table (which is a quirky little set up by the way). The barentder was cool and I hate myself for not remembering his name but we basically closed the bar out with him. 

I definitely want to come back soon and try out the food and other drinks. It's a great place for a date night or a group of friends.........err but don't all at once go the same night I'm there please!! ;)
author: Monica T.

description:
I love this place. I don't really want to write this review because I'm scared now that people will go there and it will be crowded, but I gotta. 

The bartenders are always nice. It's mostly a wine bar, but there are some beer and cider options. There's board games. It's dim but not dark. The people are also nice and the decor is cozy, intimate, and I don't have to yell to be heard. You don't feel weird if you just wanna come and read and have a glass of wine. There's always at least one guy at the bar with his laptop just hanging out.

It's close to Kabuki theater so its fun post or pre show. It's near Dosa, which is also a delicious little place nearby in case you're hungry. 

The music here ranges from funk to jazz to whatever the hell they feel like, but it's all good.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description: These guys are closed today at 1pm on Sunday even though their store sign says they're open. One star for not properly updating their store sign and online profiles! Also 3 other people came by here in the 5 mins I was outside who were all excepting it to be open :-/
author: Sameer F.

description: The ambience caught my attention just by walking by. Perfect place to touch up your resume or do some research. So much zen. Don't be afraid to meet up with a friend and catch up for some calm vibes. Relaxing playlist. Super sweet bartender by the name of Kelsy I'm glad I followed her recommendation on the veggie potato tacos. And boy o boy can she make a mean drink. I love ginger so I got The Crane cocktail super refreshing. Everything was better than expected. For sure coming back and bringing a friend.
author: Claudio A.

description: Cool bar. Interesting Murphy seats along the wall. Playlist rekindles my interest in hip-hop. Really nice wine selection and some good beers on tap.
author: Scott W.

description:
Huge fan of this place. The SO and I were waiting to eat at SBP and wanted to kill some time -- this place is pretty nearby so we decided to give it a visit around 7pm on a Sunday night. 

The Social Study is effectively half cafe, half bar -- neat combo. The decor is pretty cool -- chairs that flip out from the walls, plugs underneath the bar, books lining the walls -- it feel like that secret hideout that you've always wanted to do your work. It's also got large wooden tables for larger parties and some small nooks against walls with comfy seating. Overall, just a really neat space to be in.

They have a pretty good food/snack menu and drinks and Four barrel coffee! We got the cookies and milk and a latte. The best part about the cookies are that they actually bake them the minute that you order them, so they come out of the oven hot and delicious. The latte was also fairly decent -- a little too foamy but still decent. The SO got the fresh squeeze IPA that he was pretty happy with.

The Fillmore area has a surprising lack of coffee shops, so I love that the Social Study fills that gap. It's got a great vibe despite being half study space and half bar -- looking forward to visiting this place again in the future. 

tldr; really neat cafe and bar -- yummy snacks too! would highly recommend, great scene
author: Jasmine X.

description:
I've been dreaming about their ginger limeade for days now. If you have to go alcohol free, that's the way to do it. The ginger is so strong that it creates a cocktail-like experience of sipping a drink. 

I stopped in for a late solo lunch and also really enjoyed my Reuben with a side of pickled vegetables. I think it was a bit expensive for the size, even for here so I can't recommend it wholehearted; but the ambience, drinks, and quality means I'll definitely be back.
author: Alexi V.

description:
I came here for a some drinks before our dinner. 

This place is very cozy and the drinks were not bad. 

We ordered the Michelada and Yellow Diamond.

Michelada: was made with v8, hot sauce and red strip beer. It wasn't bad but wasn't anything special. The savory taste did hit the spot because I was not feeling anything sweet at the moment. 

Yellow Diamond: made with Lillet Blanc and Presecco. This was very refreshing. For those that are a fan of sparkling wines, I would highly recommend this!

Over this was a great place to hang out.
author: Mai W.

description:
Cool little bar that you could literally walk past and not even know it was there.  We had seen this place after a show at the Fillmore a while back and came here before dinner.  It's a very laid back atmosphere (just like a library).  

My wife had the SANFRANGRIA and I had their FILLMORE SHANDY.  Both were really good and I'd totally come back for them again.  We found two seats along the side that had pull out seats.  While they looked cool they were very uncomfortable so we decided to stand instead.
author: Blake B.

description: Popped in on a Friday night to this great little bar. The ambiance was cozy and warm and seemed to attract a younger crowd. The menu has lots of unique drinks, and tends to focus more on wine and beer cocktails. I got the Drunken Master which was really really good. Bartenders were chill too.
author: Amy M.

description: It's dark and hipster but I really liked it. Has a nice community feel. The wine list seemed decent but they were out of a by-the-glass Pinot on a Saturday night? Not a good look.  It's a small place so you either arrive early and hold down your spot or you show up whenever and hope to get a seat.  Really liked the DJ loft vibe but there was no DJ when we were there.  One thing I REALLY REALLY liked about this place was that they understand the need to be able to TALK.  Yes, the music is turned up and you still have to project but they have sound foam all over the ceiling which eliminates the echo.  So the music still sounds good, nice and loud but you can still hear your friends talking without the annoying echo/Reverb you find in so many other bars.  We checked this place out before we saw a show at the Fillmore.  I think we will be back for our next Fillmore show.
author: OtherJesus ..

description: I definitely recommend going for Happy Hour. The barbeque pork sliders were delicious and it came with a little cole slaw on the side. The passion fruit cider was also pretty good. The items were not too expensive. This place is not too loud and pretty chill. I would come back for sure.
author: Allyson L.

description: Great place to grab a beer....especially after a Fillmore concert.  The crowd was lively and Fun.  The bartenders are amazing that they can keep up with the non-stop orders.  Great vibe!
author: Amy C.

description:
2nd time hitting up this spot with the best ambiance in SF - super chill,  A+ playlist and non pretentious bay area peeps.  Ronnie was excellent catering to our wine needs (15% off bottles on Wednesday) plus a dope cheese plate  (manchego what what!) We were definitely happy patrons.
We will be back! :)
author: Jenny B.

description: My fave bar! Really good music, friendly bartenders, and great service. I would also highly recommend the Taco Tuesday special. Fun spot to go with a friend or go solo with your laptop or a book.
author: Julia L.

description:
Talk about how in love I am with this place. 

When I first walked in, it just looked like a busy, cool, hipster bar with brick wall interior and thennnnn, I saw break dancing videos being played on that wall. How dope!!!!!! 

A friend knew the owner and she hooked it up with drinks and it, oddly, reminded me of an updated/cooler CHEERS bar lol (remember that show from the 80's lol) 

We stayed there for a few hours and enjoyed the hip hop music. Very different from the vibe and music of Vegas. 
I love San Francisco!
author: Laurie V.

description: Eh, it's beer and wine only and they don't explicitly let you know when they are done serving. I don't hate, as many people seem to be enjoying the low key atmosphere. I just don't know if I'm supposed to start reading a book and dozing off into a nap. Staff could be more engaged to help people, but maybe thus place just ain't my jam.
author: Zachary T.

description: This place is cool. I mean, really cool, like just being inside makes you feel like you're cool too. I recommend it. It's a café by day and a wine bar by night, but they don't judge you if you get that backwards and order out of sequence. It also offers thematic decor, warm and inviting service, a very writer friendly atmosphere, and free Wi-Fi.
author: Kristy L.

description:
Favorite bar / study in the neighborhood. 90% of the times I would get Sweep the Leg, which has soju, thyme, lemon, pineapple, and cucumber. Never knew the mix could be so tasty and refreshing. Also tried Sanfrangria and red chile Guavarita, they were great but I guess Sweep the Leg was just unique.

Silent videos, TV shows, or movies played on the wall, with a DJ upstairs most nights. The interior was just like a study, with books and gadgets like a globe and boardgames. People also read, studied or worked on laptops here on more quiet weekday nights. Would certainly be back, maybe trying out their coffee or snacks next time.
author: Jaclyn C.

description: It was really loud when my group came in, but we had 3 shandies and a red stripe (lol). The shandies were really good, super sour, but very tasty and drinkable. Like others have said, this is a popular pre- and post- place for the Kabuki or Fillmore. When it emptied out a little, it was great and there was plenty of room. The bartenders were really cool and it felt like it was someone's house that they invited everyone to. Fun place and I'll likely return again in the future if I'm in the area.
author: Samir K.

description:
This place fucking rules. We chose to stop here for a smaller bite and drink before heading to the Masonic for Sleater-Kinney's NYE show, and I'm so glad we did.

First of all, it's gorgeous--set up to look very much like your grandpa's awesome library with a brick wall on the left side. The seating is very intimate and lends itself incredibly well to a fun date night. The bartenders couldn't have been more friendly and we were easily able to place drink and food orders at the bar without being crowded out. We had sangria to drink and tried the vegetarian potato mini tacos, BBQ pork sliders, and milk & cookies. Everything was totally delicious and priced very fairly. The cookies are fresh-baked to order...'nuff said. Also, they were showing Fantasia on the wall via projector. 

Will definitely be coming back here for future shows at the Masonic or the Fillmore!
author: Rachel F.

description:
This is a really cute little wine and beer bar! Came here with a few friends after eating dinner at State Bird. It's literally right around the corner so it's a great place to come and chill with friends after your meal.

The inside decor really lives up to the name. It has a classic type of library feel, with dim lighting, shelves full of books, and has kind of a SoHo vibe, which I loved. There was plenty of seating and it was pretty busy for a Monday night. There are seats at the bar, and the tables, and there are also little nooks in the front with benches that are intimate and a nice place to just sit and talk. They also have a collection of board and card games which was a great touch!

We didn't know they only served beer and wine until we came in, and although I was looking to get something a little stronger I didn't mind it. They also have a list of wine and soju cocktails (called 'Karatetails'), so I decided to try the Goldeneye. It was pretty good - just would have been better with a shot or two of something! The wine and beer list was pretty good, and I switched over to the Red Zinfandel after my first cocktail.

Overall I thought this was a really cute spot! The bartender was super nice and accommodating, and service overall was great. I recommend it for anyone looking for a mellow place to have a drink and catch up with friends.
author: Jaymie S.

description: I love this place ! The sliders amazing , the vibe so cool and sangria AMAZING ! It s such a cool spot.
author: Daniela A.

description: This place is has an after work meeting place vibe. Also a secret romance meeting place sort of vibe except that is smallish and it's a small world. There is a high likely hood of running into someone you know, it's at the crossroads. Fillmore and Japantown are right next door, stop in before or after.  It has an chill vibe for sure, something special. It's simple, it's straight forward. They have good drinks and music. It almost feels like a friends garage. I dig the decor and the movies (Top Gun) projected on the Brick wall.
author: Ben M.

description: Stopped in here for the wifi to work & was pleasantly surprised by Taco Tuesday- 3 tacos and a beer for $12 it shabby. Intimate place with interesting high top tables that come from the wall. They have a good wine selection as well. Not the best place for a conversation, music is jamming.
author: Liana C.

description: Trendy study spot / bar with good drinks and fast wi-fi. I had the vegetarian potato tacos too, which were delicious. However, it was a bit pricey. But what do you expect from a hipster bar in SF?
author: Maya K.

description: Good vibes. Music choice and level felt great. Lighting too low, even for me and I always look for low lighting. Chair/seat choices are all wrong--uncomfortable. I can also see that other people are uncomfortable. However, I'll definitely come here again!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
What a cool place. I stopped in here before going to a show at the Fillmore because it's literally less than a block away from the venue. It's not huge so don't plan on going here with a bunch of people. They have a variety of bites and drinks to try.

I opted for a handmade soda which was quite tasty and reasonably priced. It's a cool spot for meeting up with people before going to a show. I will definitely stop by again if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Amy J.

description:
I came here with some friends and cousins for some drinks after dinner. Great place to meet up and chat at a chill spot, since it's easy to find people. I loved the interior design with the books, brick walls, posters, and some cartoon show projected onto the screen.

The music was phenomenal. They played a bunch of hip hop from the early 2000's to today. Their sangria was delicious and $7, and it wasn't during happy hour. Drinks were a bit cheaper than most places.
author: Yenoch N.

description:
I think I just found my new favorite bar in San Francisco. Everything about Social Study is absolutely perfect, from the friendliness of the bartender and the quality of cocktails to the awesome top 40s classic hip hop and RNB and chill vibe. The wall opposite of the bar is lined with two-person seating and the seats fold into the walls. And of course there are books for days. I would love to study here someday... after I find something to study. 

My friend and I ordered the Guavarita and Sweep the Leg cocktails, which we were enjoying to the tune of Me & You by Cassie. Would highly recommend either of those drinks. I know they also have coffee and food (such as tacos) during the day, so I'll have to come back and try those. Maybe I will just camp out during the day and drink coffee until it's time for wine and cocktails. Social Study is multi-purpose!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
One time I accidentally knocked over an empty wine glass when I was sitting on those small side tables with the seats that fold out from the wall. I was trying to move a napkin out of the way and my wrist, wrist, wrist, wrist (cue Father tune) just flicked, flick of da wrist (cue non mainstream second tune). It was the loudest crash I've ever witnessed with my sober eyes in the most crowded bar I've been to. So to my dismay, everyone looked at the fallen object then to me then to the object then back to me then to Old Spice's The Man Your Man Could Smell Like. But seriously, after a long pause of silence and the background music blasting, a woman with a pixie hair cut yelled "MAZEL TOV!!!!!" and I completely cringed along with all of her friends. Bar staff happily sweeped the mess and everyone went back to their conversations like nothing happened. Thanks guys!!!! 

PSA: If you and a friend take a smoke break, putting coasters on your beers doesn't really do anything. When I returned, a couple was sitting in our spot and we had to nicely ask them to move. Awkward
author: Laurie M.

description:
I love the theme! There are books everywhere! It feels like a cozy little place to come and grab a drink. We came on a Saturday night and was surprised to find that it wasn't super crowded. Our group was able to snag a corner window spot where we were able to hang out. They also have random games that you can play with. I ordered the Little Apple with prosecco and apple nectar and it was pretty good. It pretty much tasted like a variation of apple cider with cinnamon. 

Overall, chill space to hang out and drinks weren't terribly pricey.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Loved stopping in here for a "study session". I was really there for the drinks than the studying, but that's what I love about The Social Study- the fact that you can enjoy a nice glass of alcohol and study... Or not. Either way the atmosphere was really cool. Next time I'll try some of their foods. Until then I definetely recommend this place!
author: Vanessa D.

description:
Great place for a drink.  Fantastic atmosphere and vibe, but very uncomfortable seats if by the wall.
My companions beer was well liked, my wine was perfectly ok, albeit over-priced and the potato skins were good.  Wish they had a more interesting selection of cocktails.
author: Norman B.

description:
Five adjectives to describe this place: Fresh, Hip, Cool, Trendy, Relaxing. 
I stumbled upon this uncommon coffee shop/bar while looking for a place to focus. I will definitely be frequenting The Social Study. This place is so great, I almost didn't want to tell Yelp about it...but I couldn't keep it a secret. The atmosphere is urban and refreshing, with one tall brick wall, a cute cushioned table-walll (see pics) and a tall overhanging nook for DJ's to perform after hours. In the day time, the joint is lit with plenty of fresh, natural light, and plays energizing music at a comfortably loud volume for those hoping to get a few things accomplished. I ordered a dirty chai latte, which was sweet and delicious. My only complaint was that it came out to $7.50 (before tip) because they charged a full $3 to add an espresso shot to the chai. I'll definitely be back, but I'll probably order something else a little less expensive.
author: Brooke W.

description: The atmosphere here is amazing and full of energy I came here to study so I just got the honey latte the art it came in was super cute and I really enjoyed it. I would like to try their alcoholic drinks sometime in the future and they have a happy hour that's super appealing. They have free WiFi and cute little desks/tables built into the sides of the wall I will definitely come here again :).
author: Wren X.

description:
Lately I've been getting my @$$ kicked.

...on the golf course
...and by my workload
...and by my non sports following coworkers in the March Madness pool

I have to come back to The Social Study and have them kick my @$$ with their strong drinks and chill setting.
author: Ron L.

description:
This is a very cute bar and the customer service is great! The bartenders allow you to try your choice of drink before you purchase and anything else you may want to try. The atmosphere is cool. Love the music selection and videos to go along with it. The place is tiny and not a lot of seats, but it gives you chance to meet some new people.

I ordered the Cabernet.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
We were excited to try this place since it was near our synagogue and it had good reviews. We came in and found a seat. After a couple minutes, the bartender came over to clean up some empty glasses from previous patrons. She didn't say hello to me although we had made eye contact earlier. After getting the glasses and returning to the bar, I expected her to bring us some menus. No go. 

After 20 minutes and no service, we left to go to another wine bar as there are plenty along Fillmore. Kinda sad we got such bad service.
author: Mitch C.

description:
The vibe is just so cool~, from the books to the movie projector to the guy upstairs DJ'ing. We stayed long enough to hear several of the guys climb up and DJ and I must say, each of them switched up some throwbacks that had me grooving along and just having a really good time. Fantastic music!

I ordered the Red Chile Guavarita, which had all the right flavors but maybe not enough alcohol. Probably could have used something stronger than soju, as the guava was so sweet and red chile super spicy. I got the Yellow Diamond next, which tasted like too much prosecco.

I like that there are small, private tables for two that couples can certainly take advantage of, and then there are larger tables for your parties of 6+. I like that instead of yelling "last call", they slowly start to turn on more and more lights until suddenly you realize, oh shit, I have work tomorrow.

Karatetails and Winetails were a bit of a hit and miss for me, but ambience is so hard to get right, and the Social Study nails it. I would love to come back, enjoy a wine and make friends with the DJ.
author: Stella A.

description:
The Social Study is  a pretty average place. I do really like their decor and their collection of board games, but there's something lacking in the place. The menu is pretty decent, although I would like a more in-depth description of the wines. 

My main issue with the venue is their service. We were there on a Thursday night and there was only one bartender. She was, to be honest, pretty incompetent. She messed up our order, poured wine all down the stem of the wine glass and never wiped it off, and then the biggest offense came at the end of our stay when we closed out our tab and she gave us someone else's credit card! Apparently she had already closed out someone else's tab with my fiance's credit card, they left with it, and then we were given that person's card. Needless to say the person who was given our credit card bought themselves dinner at State Bird Provision and we had to deal with the credit card company and cancel our card the next day. We won't be going back.
author: Regina L.

description:
Nothing like feeling like a learned and well-read hipster here.

Parking is available on the streets.

The place is a bit on the small size, and it is hard to fit more than groups of 4 here.  The place is rather dim, so you may not want to do too much reading here.  But you can sure feel sophistimacated.  Get out those thick rimmed black plastic glasses.

In case you do read some books here, just a heads up, the bookshelves are offset from the wall.  If you put any books too far back on the top of the shelf, they'll fall between the shelf and the back wall, never to be seen again.  Don't ask me how I know this.

I had a ginger shandy ($6 on special on Saturday).  Great taste, with just the right amount of kick. Recommended.

The DJ had the retro tunes here from the 1990s.  Blast from the past. He's located in a booth on the 2F, overlooking the place.  Very cool setup.

My friends and I left here feeling good.
author: Edward L.

description:
