I was looking for a place to do some work in San Francisco and stumbled upon a place that looked really intriguing and offered both coffee drinks and wine.  It also resembled a cool study room, complete with exposed bricks and tons of vinyl covers and old books on the wall.

I love the concept of The Social Study.  The music was nicely curated and the coffee was great.  I had a cheese plate that had been thoughtfully selected and paired with jams, honey and other sides.  The rest of the menu was equally intriguing.

I would give it more stars but the bartender and possible owner was holding a meeting with her attorney.  Many details of the problems she is having with an old business associates were discussed.  I just wanted to do some work and could have done without the extra meeting going on near my seat.

All that aside, The Social Study is the perfect place to get some work done and to relax with a glass of wine and one of the nicely prepared menu selections.
author: John L.

description: Very chill and great ambiance. Wish they'd make drinks off the menu, like a basic margarita. But overall, I finished my essay here, buzzed
author: Roxanne C.

description:
Damn, I can totally see myself returning here for both liquor and coffee. This...could be a very bad situation.  But the beers and food selection aren't overly pricey, so at least my wallet won't cringe. Much.

I walked in, and I swear the place is eclectic to my brain. Random books all over the walls (though, I guess I wouldn't have those med and bio books in my home), rap/hip-hop/R&B with more of the 90's bent, coffee, liquor, and a projector playing Finding Nemo. On repeat. Pretty damn awesome already.

Staff here were friendly, but don't come out to the tables to get your order. So...order at the bar. And if you're feeling like a lot of liquor or coffee, sit at the bar. 

There's just a few things that make it less of a 5 for me. The ceiling foam that looks like it's going to fall on my head at any time...is a bit scary. And the lack of waiter service. I guess its not too bad to walk up to the bar, but the bar also isn't set up for walk-ups...so I have to lean over people to get an order.
author: Lily W.

description:
Honey latte, ginger limeade, coffee, liquor, beer, wine, small bites, good beats, power plugs all over, high stools, wall seats, 15 grand espresso machine, make-shift "second floor" DJ section. Can you study here on a quiet afternoon? Can you get in some real interesting beertails after work? Can you bring a date here? Yes, yes and yes. That fifth star is missing only because the small bites are a tad pricey, but they do come with great quality and taste. 

Apparently it's got a reputation of some very friendly mingling...what more can you ask for?
author: Richard Y.

description: Came here to catch up with an old old friend, and since she lived right on Fillmore and Geary she suggested we hang out at the Social Study. I loved the intimate and small space of the cafe/winebar. You can see that in the mornings this place is gunning for a study atmosphere but around 5 it turns into a great happy hour/date night place. We were initially going to get a cheeseboard but then we saw the great promo/happy hour offered on sundays .. which by the way ends ends at 9, we decided to get that! For 9 dollars you get 2 fairly small but nicely sized bbq sliders, a very small cole slaw and a draft beer. Sandwiches were nicely done, spicy meaty and very tender. They only have 5 beers on tap, and I opted for a pilsner and overall I left very satisfied .
author: Eleana H.

description:
I suggest coming here if pre- or post-gaming for any nearby spot.  Their cocktails list is inventive and you should try their sangria if want it on the stronger side.

The vibe is as chill as at any drinking lounge but without the large crowd and noise that goes with it. This is not to say it's quiet as it is always full on my visits, meaning all the seats were taken. Still, it wasn't long before a table opened up. Also, there is always background music or a live DJ spinning (R&B, house, upbeat music, the classics). They also project a movie onto one of the exposed brick wall.

This is located in the middle of the block parallel to Geary Ave, near Fillmore. Parking is usually hit or miss depending on time of day/night but should find some spaces within a couple blocks at most.
author: Peter L.

description: Really cool bar with nice ambience. Come here to have a couple of drinks when on a date or a night out.
author: Nirav S.

description:
Wine + 90s hip hop = I'm a fan.

Went at 9:00 PM on a Friday night and was able to snag a table. Good wine selections, all very reasonably priced. I got a glass of Barbera, my friend tried the Montepulcianoo, both of which we enjoyed. The DJ was playing a good mix of music, too. The place started to fill up around 10:00 PM.
author: Rachel C.

description: This place is tiny! I got lucky and snagged two seats at the bar before our show at the Fillmore. Great selection of bar snacks, I had the BLT and it was delicious! Love the decor and ambiance, convenient stop to grab a drink before a show at the Fillmore.
author: Briget P.

description: Super cozy spot and cute set up! The latte I ordered was lovely. The barista was sweet and the only complaint I have was kind of lack of seating? I got a good spot after somebody left but the weird half seats on the wall are uncomfortable. The couch cushion wall with books itself is super cute but the half seats aren't ideal. Overall great though  happy I stumbled upon this place, I noticed a DJ area at the top loft thing? I'd like to come through for Happy Hour and music if they do that
author: CoffeeKhaleesi B.

description: I love this place.  I had a 3 hour wait between meetings and had a wonderful blt and glass of wine. Harmony the bartender is a doll and a total blast!!! Met a lot of amazing people.
author: Tonia H.

description: Nice lil bar, great music, great service, drinks are a little weak but tasty. If you like spicy drinks, definitely get the red chile guava jawn. Again, tasty but two drinks in I still had no buzz. Only downside to the location is they have some shady characters around the neighborhood. I witnessed a drug deal happening about 10 feet away from the front door and 15 mins after being in the bar what looked like a gang member (he had tattoos on his forehead, neck and all over his head, one big one that said 245 on his skull) walked into the bar, presumably went to the bathroom for a few mins and literally walked out with a Crack pipe in his hand.  So turns out he wasn't a banger, just a Junkie. Anyway, I guess that adds to the hipster ambiance. Felt very much like Brooklyn in the early 90's... #throwback
author: Sugardumplin Z.

description: Love this place. Great interior vibe, nice bartenders and great selection of beers and sake. Really chill place to just hang out with some friends and pass the time as life floats on by.
author: Clinton L.

description:
This place is intimate without bumping elbows with your neighbors, offers hearty snacks (til 9:30) and drinks, and close to a lot of other things-- making it a great before/after stop (or, if I lived in the neighborhood, an evening on its own). 

While I'm bummed they don't have a full bar, they do get remarkably creative with what they have: beyond the beer and wine lists, they offer beertails, winetails, and "karatetails" (soju mixed drinks). I tried the Yellow Diamond (lillet blanc, prosecco, and mandarin peel) which was refreshing without being overly sweet. A little pricey at $9, considering it isn't as strong as either a glass of wine or a regular cocktail, but fine for a one-time try.

I also wish the kitchen stayed open even an hour later. I stopped by after a Kabuki movie where I'd skipped dinner, and missed the kitchen closing at 9:30. Some of the menu items didn't even need any preparing, so even if they had a reduced late-night menu that'd be a great next step.
author: Krista L.

description:
Good SanFrangria (Red Sangria) - I had a buzz going with the first one, I had two so I was doing really good after the second one. Happy Hour price was $5.  They also have food.

I loved the ambiance. It was small but very trendy and chill. The owner girl was super nice, the other bartender was not as friendly but he was efficient enough. 

They are sort of a cross between a coffee shop and a lounge.  I think they have a beer and wine license because they alcoholic beverages seemed to be more wine, sake and beer related.  

The lounge is off Geary across the street from the backside of the Japan Center. I didn't even realize it was there until I saw it on yelp. If you are looking for a cool little spot to grab a drink and you are in the J-town area, this place won't disappoint.
author: Mel D.

description:
If Social Study existed when I was in college, I would be...

1) Broke.
2) An alcoholic.
3) FAT.

Oh wait, I'm all of those things already...a fat brokaholic. *sigh*

Part café and part bar, Social Study is a cute and cozy neighborhood lounge serving Four Barrel Coffee, Beer, Wine, Bar Bites, Charcuterie Plates, Sandwiches, and Pastries. It's like the Sugar Café of the Fillmore (my review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/sugar-cafe-san-francisco#hrid:VjXjgP-DcKCygEyQExIexQ) but with a low-key, vintage hipster vibe with an electronic blue padded wall with fold down seats, exposed red brick walls, a communal table and a rustic wooden bar. On nights the DJ isn't spinning from the balcony above, 90s Hip-Hop is played in the background along with movies from that era. 

Social Study is perfect for a chill happy hour, pre/post dinner drinks, and/or post-movie drinks because it's just one block away from Sundance Kubuki. Is it a good place to study at? Ummm, after several glasses of wine, the only thing you'll be "studying" is the cutie you're eye-goggling from across the room. HOLLA! *Wink Wink*

Thank goodness, Social Study never existed when I was in college.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Great place! Cheap good alcohol & nice atmosphere & music. Highly recommend! Would come back! Loved the books!
author: Alice Z.

description:
**Review is for the BAR only**

Do you know any pranksters?  Cuz I do.  Two types, in fact - both a prankster and a PranQster.  The former thinks he's funny.  The latter tastes awesome.  Though, I guess I should be thanking the prankster for introducing me to The PranQster.  

A coffee shop by day and a bar by night, The Social Study is similar to Sugar Cafe down by Union Square (minus the hard alcohol).  However, I like the vibe here a lot better.  While Sugar Cafe is a little more spacious and trendy, The Social Study is smaller with a much more intimate and mellow vibe.  Which, essentially, makes them my kind of spot.  Of course, it didn't hurt that the DJ was playing a bunch of 90's hip-hop either.

Since we were only stopping in for drinks after having dinner at State Bird, I can't speak to the bar bites listed on the menu (or the cafe offerings, for that matter).  However, I did like the selection of beers and wines that were available.  Especially the PranQster.  The giant ass bottle it came in was a little unexpected ("Dude, it's that small bottle, not the big one."), but it certainly was delicious!

With its relaxed ambiance welcoming nature, and relatively cheap prices, I'd definitely come back to The Social Study, whether it be for some coffee, enjoying a drink or two with friends, or to cap off a hot date with a girl.  After all, things only get livelier when there's a little PranQster in you!
author: Mike L.

description:
I love this bar. 

First off, it's right across the street from Kabuki Springs spa, my go-to for a good soak. 

The first time I went there I didn't even have a drink. Only the chicken salad sandwich. Which was so good, I had to come back only 2 weeks later. (I live nowhere near this area). When I was there in the day originally, there were lots of people with their laptops out. This seems like a great little place to get some work done during the day. They have a good coffee and tea selection. It kind of doubles as a cafe/bar.

Next time I was there, my friend and I met for drinks and stayed all night. It's definitely an intimate setting. Lots of seating for 2 people, some community high tops but that's about it. Music selection is always inspiring. First time I was there they were playing motown, last time they had a DJ that was really matching the vibe of the place.

The staff is incredibly endearing and pretty cute too. They recommended drinks to us all night and we loved everything we had. I think they only sell beer, wine, and agave wine and such - no hard liquor - but I hardly missed it. And I'm a die-hard bourbon girl. I was impressed at the inventiveness and sheer tastiness of the cocktails we had. We left very sauced up and happy.

I highly recommend this little hideaway bar for the type of person who prefers a more intimate and curated experience. 5 stars.
author: Jenna K.

description: The drink was refreshing! I had the Sweep the Leg and it was sweet and fresh - the cucumber was a nice touch. I loved the atmosphere, too. The books and library feel was nice, and the leather wall was quite intimate.
author: Josh C.

description: Came here for happy hour with a friend and really liked this cute little spot. The sangria and tacos were great, and the bar tender was super friendly. Wasn't amazing, but will prob be back!
author: Tiffany T.

description: I came here ~11pm on a Friday night, and this small and cozy bar was pretty poppin inside. There was some gooooooood throwback hip hop playing, and I loved loved loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Definitely coming back here for the music (I think the DJ stopped spinning around midnight though). I want to check out this place during the day! If people really do study here during the day, I may come back here 23493024934 more times to work, drink, and eat.
author: Annie S.

description: Cozy drinking spot that serves beer and wine only.  Staff is friendly and it's a quiet place to take someone for some drinks and conversations.  Inside is decorated like a library with books everywhere.
author: Ted Y.

description:
In my more youthful days this place might have had a lot more appeal to me as a place to hang out with friends, enjoy a few drinks and catch up in loud conversation, but some of us change as we grow older and this place was simply a convenient place for our group to step into and unwind for a bit.

My friends and I had just completed a long volunteer shift doing kitchen prep work then serving as waitstaff for a fundraiser benefiting the nearby Creative Arts Charter School.  There were just a handful of us so we ended up working our collective butts off first preparing and assembling appetizer and dessert plates then walking around the venue serving dozens upon dozens of rounds of appetizers to paying guests.  The event staff kept us well hydrated, and the awesome chefs from Charles Phan's Slanted Door kept us well fed and even packed up some huge plates of leftover delicacies for all of us to take home.

All that work left us drained though and we really needed a place to just sit down, chill and reboot for the evening.  Social Study was just around the corner.  We looked inside and saw there was an empty communal table that could fit all of us so we decided to give them some business for the night.

The place is darkly lit mostly from dim overhead lighting very high above on their acoustically enhanced ceiling and by bowls of flickering candlelight on the table tops.  The Social Study theme is well represented with books (many were law reference books of the kind that nobody actually reads) stacked and lined across one wall atop comfortable looking individual booths.

Their menu is quite varied featuring small bites, many wines, draft and bottled beers and hot coffee drinks served in round bowl-like mugs.  You order at the bar, get your drinks and return to your table.  The bar staff was working in slow motion though and as more people walked in the line just grew longer and longer.  I guess having a varied drink menu doesn't always work in their favor.  We heard one of the ladies behind the bar apologize a few times for the long wait.  It all worked out and we all got our drinks eventually.

The tall wooden chairs weren't super comfortable but it was a seat and all of us really just wanted to sit down.  We toasted the night knowing that all of us worked really well together and we had just rocked a successful fundraiser for an awesome school.  My bottled beer was ice cold, and we were getting the rest we wanted so badly.

As the place became more crowded we found ourselves having to speak louder and louder just to hear each other.  They had loud hip-hop (Jay-Z, Beastie Boys, etc...) music blaring in the front of the house and they were projecting the movie "Sin City" high above the brick wall.  I enjoyed the random scenes of ultra violence on the big screen, but the combination of loud music, loud conversation and other people crowded behind our chairs grew tiring very quickly.  We finished our drinks and collectively agreed to get out of there.

For just a moment this was a great place to chill.  Thanks Social Study for presenting to us that moment!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Great first date place - you can start off with coffee but then move to other drinks. :) Their mixed drinks are always tasty and creative with their use of sake, beer, etc. The staff is also always friendly and attentive.
author: Roberta V.

description:
My new favorite not-in-my-neighborhood-neighborhood spot. 

A great, chill place to grab a drink (or coffee or snack) - I've never had a problem getting a seat at 6 pm or 9 pm. I'm surprised this place isn't more crowded. 

Pros:
- Solid beer and wine menu
- Games!
- Good mix of noise/music and chill vibe so it's good for low-key work or catching up with friends
- Free wifi
- Big windows that let in a lot of light

Cons:
- There's sometimes only one person behind the bar so it can take a bit of time to get your drink
- Later in the evening, it gets a little more "ntz ntz"
author: Wendy L.

description: This bar is awesome. I come here all the time after work to grab a glass of wine and wrap up my work day (send emails etc). But it's also a great spot to bring your friends for a couple of drinks and a bite to eat. There's something about the music selection that actually makes it really easy to get work done here and also inviting and upbeat if u do choose to be social. (Marvin Gaye, Frank ocean, Jimi, can't go wrong!) Drink wise - I almost always get a Malbec or red wine - the bartenders are always really helpful if I do want to explore and try a little taste before investing in an entire glass, which is really great especially because it can be very busy at times. If you're getting food I absolutely recommend the pork sliders or cheese plate. Super satisfying. Overall amazing place. Glad this is close to where I live. Will always continue to come back here. Keep up the wonderful vibes :)
author: McKenzie D.

description: Can you do work with a drink in your hand? If yes, this is the place to go. I grabbed a nice glass of Malbec and cranked out a few applications here. I was here during the day and it was pretty packed. They have a very funky blue decor, which is great if you are into taking some cool photos (maybe for your instagram). I will want to try to come back here in the evening sometime, looks like they have some fun movies playing.
author: Nikita K.

description:
WARNING: This restaurant is full of critical food inspections violations -- violations that could potentially force the San Francisco Department of Public Health to revoke its operating permit. Not to be confused with the academic grading systems The Social Study's 77 health score endangers its current operations and potentially your health.

Concerning Food Inspection Violations Include: 

* Unapproved or unmaintained equipment or utensils
* Improper thawing methods !
* Unpermitted food facility
* Inadequate and inaccessible handwashing facilities !
* Unclean or unsanitary food contact surfaces !
author: TJ S.

description: I came here for drinks on a random Wednesday night, and I had a great time. I loved that they lined a wall with books, and had a DJ booth up top. Overall, delicious drinks, good music, and cool atmosphere. Definitely will go back to try out some food!
author: Sarah L.

description: Pretty cool bar. We found it on yelp and thought it would be quieter for a place to grab a quick diner. It's actually a bar that's pretty packed on a weekend night. Cool bar, small and local.
author: Sara A.

description: Great spot, came right in time for happy hour and enjoyed the house wine along with the sliders and tacos. Both were delicious!
author: Steven P.

description: BEST bar/dining experience EVER! After the catastrophe otherwise known as State Bird Provisions, our night was SAVED when we came here! Best Wine! Best Bartender! Best Food!! Especially the Cuban Sliders!! Go here!!! Trust me! (Coming from a well versed Michelin diner)
author: George T.

description:
Date & Time:  Thursday January 12, 2012 @ 3pm
Scene:  Locals in Layered Tanks, Sweaters, Minis & Tights
Vibe:  Chill
Music:  Prince
Decor:  Classic SF:  Exposed Brick Wall,  Book Lined Shelves, LPs,  Communal Table, Blue Vinyl Booths
Service:  Trendy, Attractive Staff
Imbibe:  Four Barrel, Beer, Vino & Sangria Available
Devour:  Roasted Nuts, The Board Meeting(Charcuterie) & Cinnamon Rolls
Total:  $21
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
The Social Study is definitely a great place to be social! I brought my group of friends here in the middle of the Ramen Festival this past weekend. We couldn't get any ramen and what better way to drown our sorrows than with some beer, wine, and soju cocktails? 

I got THE CRANE and thought it was super refreshing, especially after fighting my way through hordes of people in the Peace Plaza. I couldn't taste the soju but definitely felt it soon (although that might be due to lack of eating -- curse you long lines at Ramen Festival!). I loved the light citrusy taste paired with the subtle heat of the ginger syrup. My friends enjoyed the sangria and hard apple cider. For a quick bite, I recommend the POTATO BRUSCHETTA -- the potato paste and spicy tomatoes over toasted bread was delicious. 

Upon walking through the door of The Social Study I immediately fell in love with the decor. Books lined the shelves along the wall and multiple board games were sitting in shelves around the room. I can definitely see how they incorporated the "study lounge" feel into this bar.

Unfortunately the place was a bit more cozy than I expected and my party of 8 had a hard time squeezing in. I think coming back with a group of 6 people or less would be ideal. We managed to snag a table to hang out for an hour or so before our dinner reservations later. 

I would definitely come here again for a nice hangout spot in Japantown. Hopefully we can play some games next time.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: Nice little spot to stop in for a drink and snack, though I can't comment much because we just did the cheese and salami plate and I only drank tea. I did like the space and it wasn't too crowded, which seemed idea for hanging out or working.
author: Shing H.

description: I went on a first date here and it was a good choice--cozy, fun cocktail choices, good music. I had expected more of a library vibe but by the time we were there (8 or so) it seemed more like a relaxed bar/cafe. It's not big, but we were lucky to score a tiny high table on the side. A nice place to go with a friend or a date -- not really a pregamey vibe although there are clubs nearby.
author: Lynne C.

description:
*REVIEW FOR BAR ONLY*

This place is freakin awesome.
Literally in the heart of J-Town. We decided to stop in here since we were super early for Origin and decided to sit and pre-game nearby. This place is literally around the corner.

I LOVE THE INTERIOR OF THIS PLACE. It looks like a study of a rich person's home. Lol. On Saturday night, there was a DJ playing some good 90's jams. The FEELS!

We came in as the drinks were pretty damn inexpensive considering the location and how nice the place looked. I think beers started around $5-6 and cocktails about $8-10? No hard alchy. Keeps the place NOT RATCHET. Kinda nice actually.

Came in around 9 and most of the big tables were taken.. I could see this place getting crowded later on in the night but overall I think it's a nice spot to kick it. Only gripe is that there's only 1 unisex bathroom for the place!

I imagine this place would be SUPER CUTE in the daytime or evening for a date!
author: Emily C.

description: The atmosphere of The Social Study is very dim, loud music from a live DJ, and very casual. By 9pm on a Saturday, it was packed with people. They serve a variety of Beer and Wine Cocktails as well as other extravagant drinks, but be sure to try the Sangria!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
What a great spot! Now, I will disclose I've only been for drinks in the evening. I've not been here for their coffee or in the afternoon. I recently went in with some friends from out of town. We tried to look for a spot open late on a weeknight. My friend wanted coffee, and my other friend and me were just communing for the booze. Thankfully, all three of us got what we wanted (err, almost... my friend who wanted coffee succumbed to peer pressure and got a libation as well). 

Anyway, The Social Study is a fun place -- namely because the bartenders were friendly, the cocktails were amazing, the music was a mixture of R&B (!!)/pop/old school, and they were playing the "Golden Girls" on the projector facing a brick wall. This is definitely a locals' spot; most folks looked like regulars or neighborhood residents. There was a mix in terms of age range... some were in their early 20s, some in their mid-40s. There are three doubles in the back near the bar - the tables have foldable cushiony chairs (hard to explain... you'll have to see it for yourself). There are long communal tables that seat plenty of folks. The night we went in, there was a semi-private birthday party happening so it was extra boisterous... May I remind you this was like... a Tuesday. 

I'd definitely return. Some places make a great first impression, and The Social Study did just that.
author: James Z.

description: Loved the moody, laid back vibe. I came here alone around 9 pm on a Tuesday and was surprised to find it filled on a weeknight. I found myself bugging Siri frequently to find out what song was playing, happy to have made some discoveries that I can add to my Spotify playlists!
author: Danielle M.

description:
Was really impressed by this charming little spot right next to the Fillmore. 

I can imagine it's a great place to get work done in the afternoon or meet up with friends for a coffee or beer. 

I loved how cozy it felt and the staff was polite enough. There was ample seating all around, small tables for 1-2 and a handful of larger tables for bigger groups. 

Will definitely swing on by before a show at the Fillmore, or on our way out for a night cap!
author: Siobhan F.

description:
This place is so fun! 
It's a bar tucked away on the side of Geary that had a speak easy feel and a musical charm. True to its name, there are books all along the walls of the bar and when I walked in I saw people studying ha!  The night I came they were setting up a projector on top of the books and they played scooby Doo films! 
They only serve beer and wine cocktails (no hard liquor). 
The DJ booth is located above the bar in a loft fashion and it looked like it would be a fun place to stay late on a Friday night. 

Wine cocktails are good, very sweet!
author: Kristin C.

description: So excited to have stumbled upon the Social Study! Good happy hour. Cool drinks. Tasty bites. Chill vibe. Awesome music and live DJ. We had a large group of 10 people and the bartenders were very friendly and accommodating. And they have milk and freshly baked cookies whaaaaaa! We all left happy and satisfied! I think I may have just found my favorite bar in SF, and will definitely be back!
author: Nana L.

description:
I love the music here, old school hip hop.
I love the decor here, warm, cozy, romantic.

The sliders they have is pretty good, Sangria is ok.
author: Moto B.

description:
Not a ton of seating, but wasn't too crowded in a Tuesday. 
And had tables for sharing. (not to bad)
author: Michael R.

description: Cute spot with tons of drink options- including Macedonian and South African wine. Be prepared for all the fun group outings and first time tinder dates. Movies and tasteful music a def plus!
author: Cho S.

description: Great spot for a post-kabuki outing! Last time I was there with friends we snagged a front table and set up camp with a couple bottles of nice red wine. We were also really happy about the music which was a collection of throwback r&b. Cute and cozy!
author: DeAnna C.

description:
Looks the part of hipster SF with the exposed brick walls and dark wood. And I love the chairs that fold out from the wall. Note that it's beer/wine only--they do some beer/wine-tails. Best to look for a night when it's not SUPER crowded and chill with some friends to stay true to the whole vibe of being more relaxed. 

Personally I prefer going at night over during the day.
author: Vivian C.

description:
It's good, for the location and such I give it thumbs up. Music is chill. Don't really get why someone would come here to "Study" or get coffee... for me its mos def a Happy Hour place. As in, if I'm going out here, its for the alc. 

Bartender was kinda distracted (very much into his phone), and didn't bother to check on us once... which, I guess is typical for a bar-type place. But, for $55 for a bottle of wine and one cheese plate, you could probably look up from your phone once. 

Presentation of cheese plate and wine was good, though.
author: Kim D.

description:
Delicious food - definitely recommend the veggie sandwich and veggie tacos. Dirty chai latte was so good.

Nice vibe - good music and cozy/fun decor.
author: Puja S.

description: Cute little wine and beer bar in the Fillmore. They don't sell hard alcohol but have a good selection of cocktails they make with soju. Very cool decor and ambiance, kind of had a bit of a speakeasy feel. They have a booth with a DJ on Friday nights. Nifty spot!
author: Angela K.

description: I think this might be my new favorite bar. I love "craft cocktails" but the whole speakeasy, industrial rustic, fancy cocktail bar is really getting tired in this city and I've been yearning for something different. I realize how ridiculous I sound complaining about craft cocktail bars but it's the truth. Enter the Social Study. They've got great cocktails and a solid wine list, so they check that box off. The feel of this place is awesome and what sets it apart. It's some sort of mix of the 90s and a bit of So-Cal skater vibe all perfectly wrapped up into an intimate bar with a Brooklyn feel. It sounds eclectic but it all blends together perfectly. They also have a snacks list including homemade chocolate chip cookies and milk if you decide you need something to nibble on. I don't really want to spread the word on this hidden gem but you should check it out.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Oddly enough, I did come here to study and get work done because I love drinking and I was drawn to the idea of alcohol + work.

There were a few others who were at the bar doing work as well. It's not the greatest place to be productive, especially because of the dim lighting and the small tables. It got considerably worse as the Saturday afternoon progressed--the music changed from an ambient chill to loud hip-hop, a game was projected onto the wall, and the level of noise got pretty loud pretty quickly. I chose to leave at that point.

However, the bartenders were attentive, the drinks were yummy, and the Cuban sliders I ordered were absolutely fantastic.

As a bar, 4 stars.
As a cafe, 3 stars.
author: Queenie T.

description: A great, very chill local place that's great for grabbing a beer or glass of wine before dinner or for a casual date or just to relax. They do only beer and wine and some food which I've never had. Very comfortable atmosphere, books, sometimes a movie is playing. Will return.
author: Jordan C.

description: I'm really digging this space on a random block off Fillmore! Great addition to the area. It's super chill, has high ceilings and a wall of books. Assortment of beers, wines, beertails and winetails. I only had the sangria and a cocktail but both were awesome, super refreshing and not too sweet thank goodness. Lovely bartenders. Definitely coming back. I recruited everyone to come over for happy hour with me :)
author: Vivian H.

description: Haven't been to this location in a while and it's really nicely redone. Great beverage options. Nice looking snacks, although I didn't eat anything. Nice service and cool job working with the limited space. Fantastic spot for a pre-filmore  show
author: Matthew T.

description:
This place is too cool! Coffee shop, bar, and study lounge all rolled into one. I've been searching for some time for somewhere that I can do work and really get into the zone. The Starbucks on Fillmore just hasn't been cutting it recently. Loud, closes early, and awfully exposed to outside distractions. Walk a little bit south on FIllmore though and take a left at Geary, and you're in a completely different world! 

First off, I'm a huge fan of dim-lights when I do work and when I do drank. And sometimes even when I do eats. So I knew when I set foot in The Social Study that I would enjoy my time there. The very very first thing I noted beyond the dim lighting was the general atmosphere about the place. Macbooks scattered about with their lights glowing bright in the low light, coffee cups and wine glasses at everybody's side, and the occasional group of friends/couples engaged in conversation. There was a DJ booth one floor above, although it was empty when I was there (9 pm on a Sunday night) and a movie being projected onto a wall with hip hop playing in the background. FANTASTIC. I don't fancy myself a hipster, but I do enjoy it when a cafe gives off a hipster vibe and this place fit the bill. Even had a book shelf with books on the side. 

I'm not a huge coffee drinker (especially at 9 pm) and it was a bit late for grub so I just ordered up myself some tea and got to work by joining the ranks of customers with their Macbooks out. Got some productive work done and left after last call. I'm definitely coming back here for my studying/productive needs, and most likely coming here for my eating and drinking needs too.
author: Philip W.

description:
Amazing music (remix of non top-40 hip hop and rap) with extremely friendly bartenders. Our bartender alerted us to an opening at a roomier side of the bar with instructions to "swoop in!" 

We ordered a bottle of Chilean cab sauv and it was delicious. Great place to hang out for a drink after work.
author: Furai X.

description:
This place is hip, there's always a movie being protected, and a dj spinning upbeat lounge tunes. There's also board games!

The drinks I have tried have all been great, they rotate their menu and usually go with a theme similar to Trick Dog. This is a great date spot or casual hang out spot. It has remained low key (isn't your average crowded bar). They also serve coffee drinks!
author: Vicky H.

description: Even though I really like this place, I'd like it even more if they had a full liquor licence!  Still, they have a good selection of wine, friendly bartenders, and a chill atmosphere despite the full house on most nights.  In an area with a dearth of good bars, this place is a welcome find and a good choice if you're looking for a drink pre or post SBP or Kabuki.
author: Joanne G.

description: Such a fun little spot. Great food. Great drinks. Perfect music to listen to while spending the day working there. Try the Ginger Limeaid.
author: Danielle S.

description: This is a cool place to hang out, very casual. The soju drinks are awesome but I would need to go back and try the food. If you like a little spice I would get the Red Chile Guavarita drink or if you want something refreshing go for the Sweep the Leg.
author: Samantha J.

description: Top ten bar in SF. Cozy and chill vibe. Old and/or random movies and TV shows play from a projector on the wall. Beer/kara-tails are so good. Guinness Chocolate Factory is a good one for sweet lovers.
author: Eryn D.

description: I love this place! Definitely the best date spot in SF. Very intimate setting, awesome ambience! Love thei Taco Tuesday deal - 3 tacos and a beer for $10. Can't beat it!
author: Clay P.

description:
I can tell you as a student and lover of coffee, I approve of the Social Study!
I had a "blind date" here and this was their gem they were sharing with me. 
I loved the vibe and the latte that first day I went. Haha and the company was nice as well if you're wondering.
Its a great place to come and study for a few hours as well as a place to come and be social.
The people working here are friendly and willing to answer any questions and help and indecisive people, like me. I can never decide between a nice cup of coffee or having a nice glass of ethanol to go with my research so they'll usually help sway my mind. 
Definitely a place to return to.
author: Eff B.

description: 5-stars to this awesome wine bar located near the cozy intersection of the Fillmore. Seating is limited, so try to secure a spot before ordering drinks. The bar area is small, but the bartender was very attentive to the guests. Behind him/her they offer a number of red, whites, and brews on tap. This lounge has an intimate setting, and would be a great place for smaller parties.
author: Sarin P.

description:
This place is a nice little spot which a good vibe. If you happen to go during happy hour, it's packed and worth going to dinner and coming back. When it's not happy hour, the crowd is manageable. The bartender working on the night I was there was great. He remembered my drink from the very first order and was pleasant. He was the only one working and managed the orders with speed and care.

The drinks were good and weren't badly priced. Overall, I'll be back.
author: Scott C.

description: Loved this place. Quiet(ish), unassuming, awesome decor & vibe and a pretty solid menu.
author: Amber K.

description: Service is terrible. Staff rushed us on our orders and were generally rude and unfriendly. Too bad because the coffee is good and we used to like the atmosphere.
author: Anthony B.

description: Waiting for a table at State Bird Provisions? This is THE place to pass the time. Check out the menu -- there is so much to choose from. They have Winetails, Beertails and Karatetails. My friends and I chose to try their Karatetails. With a slight chuckle (because the Karatetail menu has a slight reference to the Karate Kid movies), I opted for the Red Chile Guavarita (I've been obsessed with spicy cocktails lately) and the Crane. Very tasty cocktails! We ordered the Cuban sliders and a cheese plate. The ambiance was very cool! Love the brick and the books on the wall. They have tall tables and lower tables by the window. A great place to hangout!
author: Belle V.

description:
I've only ever come by for coffee and for a quiet place to read, but I dig this place a lot. Casual with a bit of fanciness, and very mellow. It would be a good place to meet someone for a drink, or maybe to meet up before a movie at the Kabuki or a concert at the Fillmore.

They also serve Four Barrel coffee, which is a plus in our neighborhood low on great coffee options.
author: Andrew M.

description:
The seats are too small, and it's beer and wine only.

A great spot to hang prior to a movie or a State Bird reservation.
author: Anoo L.

description:
What a great find! A friend brought me here after dinner, and I was sad to know I'd been unaware of such an awesome place. 

Our cocktails were fantastic (they have a very creative cocktail list, with mixed drinks of beer, wine, soju and more). The bartender was friendly, and the atmosphere and music were just right. 

Wasn't there on a DJ night, but the DJ loft looked really cool--and I definitely plan to return.
author: David Z.

description: First timer and loved it!! Super cozy and easy going and omg the Asian bartender is sooooo cute!!! Cheese plate totally on point..... I'll be back!!
author: Tessa G.

description: I REALLY hate leave a 3 star review because the food was great (I had the Fillmore shady) and I also loved the whole cozy library vibe the place has but the service was really slow. It took about 15 minutes for someone to come and take our order and it took another twenty minutes for our food to arrive. Everything was hot and delicious but the wait was entirely too long for dinner and drinks.
author: Mike B.

description:
Im a huge fan of the social study! They're open in the afternoon so it's great to take a quick coffee meeting or cram in some work on your laptop during the week. They're kind enough to share their wifi so you can have a full meal while being efficient. 
And evenings have an awesome chill scene -- a bit like a lounge. Always great music lightly playing in the background. 
And the bar bites are great! Love the pulled pork sliders and the tacos. 
Appreciate that they have a few fun beertails & winetails on the menu too. 
Decor is unique and feels like you can have a conservation (it's the only bad I've seen with murphy-style seating which is quite comfy)
author: Kaego R.

description: Love this place! Awesome local coffee hangout during the day and swanky bar at night! Great DJs on the weekend. A must if you're heading to The Fillmore for pre or post show drinks!
author: Rodney D.

description:
4 stars for interior decor and ambience. 
3 stars for service and quality of barista 

Randomly stop by and see this artsy cafe/wine shop, I told myself conning in and try. 
First impression, wow... artsy and nice decorated. Love the theme of film, literature, music....
Nice selection of wine, beers, beertails, winetails, coffee and some bites. 

Ordered a cup of mocha, waited... 
Barista forgot it. It's okay. I'm not in a hurry at all. I feel disappointed by the quality of the taste not service. 
Just an ordinary mocha. No presentation, taste ordinary...

Maybe a better barista to make a cup of better coffee? Everything will be perfect then:p

Forget about my coffee, I like the place at the first sight. I will definitely come back for wine/ beer. 
As a wine/ beer bar, they open late around midnight.
Live music featuring by different DJ, Jazz music included... Cannot miss it
author: JustinE Y.

description:
Fun spot! Popped in for a nightcap and definitely enjoyed my time there. Good selection of drinks and snacks, a dj spinning up top, and cartoons projecting on brick wall! 

Located in a bit of a random spot, but I'd totally seek this place out again.
author: Brianna M.

description:
We dropped in here before going to the Boom Boom room to see a show and what a cute little spot this is!  I was wondering why this place was called "The Social Study" and once I walked in, I instantly understood why.  They had books lined up around the perimeter, and it looked like a leather study with square seats that popped out of the walls.  I'm not the best at describing things but it looked like a fancy library in an old mansion, only updated with tea light candles and a projector that was showing "Coming to America" on the brick wall above the bar.  

Since I don't drink alcohol, I ordered a Ginger Limeade and it was so good that I sipped that up like a kid dying of thirst on a hot day.
author: Lorie N.

description:
Social Study Recipe
(Yield 1)

- Take one serving "Sugar Cafe" on Sutter. Reserve the comfortable seating and dark modern decor. Trim excess head-fat/douchebaggery due to Cellar and the Marina wannabes from next door to Sugar Cafe.

- Add one tbsp of Bourbon and Branch. The drinks at Sugar Cafe are not interesting nor have they changed in years. Social Study has a much more unique drink menu - lots of chocolate based ones, which as the rare straight male chocoholic is appreciated.

- When marinating, move away rest of Fillmore which is turning into a baby Marina. I think teacup Chihuahuas outnumber people at this point.

- Serve hot. They don't have air conditioning, and just my luck I came here the hottest Saturday in the last decade.
author: Rishi G.

description: Small tables, interesting snacks and cocktails, and board games, all in a place that looks like a small library. What more could you want?
author: Gabe B.

description:
Laptop camper here. While I like the concept of a social hangout space, but something feels like it's missing. The Four Barrel lattes ($4) are excellent but the breakfast pastries (scones, muffins, croissants) are run of the mill. The pound cake ($2) was dense and dry. The morning bun was okay but after heating, was still cold inside.  I wouldn't mind getting a sandwich or bagel but they don't have anything besides pastries till evening time. 

Of course I love the library inspired décor with old books, old albums, and the exposed brick wall. The chairs aren't comfortable. The free wi-fi is fast but there's only one outlet. 

The DJ booth above is always empty during the day. They play music pretty loud even during the day (when there isn't a DJ), so it's hard to actually study or concentrate. 

Shouldn't a study session be quieter? 

You know you love me. X0 X0, laptop camper.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Probably my second favorite bar in San Francisco after Upcider. This is just my kind of place. The vibe is excellent and incredibly chill. Its almost scary to write a review about it because it feels like such an unknown secret but really people should know about this place cause they deserve all the business. 

Located just a couple blocks from the shopping and restaurants of upper Fillmore and far enough from the sketchy parts of the Fillmore its is the perfect location for grabbing drinks on a date or after work. There are never a ton of people here which is really great. If don't want it to feel like work to go to a bar then this is your place. It is a very small location with minimal seating at the bar or otherwise. You are welcome to stand make your own seating. There are games as well for those wanting some board game action. There are also books everywhere. I forget the story but they are incredibly random and fun to thumb through. There is an attic above the bar area where a DJ plays tunes on random nights and during the weekend. 

Sometimes there are random movies and old tv shows being displayed on the wall. I never know what its going to be so I can't tell you what to expect. I saw scooby doo once but then I love lucy another time so yea who knows.

The music deserves its own five stars. Whether its a dj or a set playlist in the background you will hear some of your favorite 90's R&b or even classic blues and soul like Otis Redding or Sam Cooke. The best playlist in the city hands down. 

Its very dark in the place which adds to its chill vibe plus wifi makes it a great place to get work done or drink with someone special. The bartenders are excellent and their drink menu is incredibly fun. There are mixed drinks that are very rare and exclusive to the social study. You owe it to yourself to try them. 

Its usually really quiet and intimate here which makes it perfect for meeting people or dates. Candles flickering dark atmosphere and being surrounded by couples feels good. 

Whether you are looking to kill sometime before heading into Fat Angel or seeing a band at the Fillmore this place is the best reason to come into this area. Fillmore has always been a favorite place of mine and the social study defines what makes going out in San Francisco special. Will forever be a loyal customer to this establishment.
author: Nick R.

description:
Great ambiance and cool vibe. Great place to hang out and let loose. The staff are very friendly and quick to serve you. Awesome Happy Hour. It is small and laid back. 

Check it out if you like a great cup of coffee or to kick back and unwind with a drink. 

d.
author: Donald H.

description:
Came on a Sunday night around 8pm (while waiting for our Statebird Provisions reservations at 9:30) and there was a good mix of ppl.  Half empty but not awkwardly quiet.  It's a cute fun place with a good mix of music.
Decent little wine list (even though it's more of a beer and cocktail place).
Dim lighting, bar seats, table bar seating for 2 and a couple areas for bigger groups.
author: Tammie C.

description: The Social Study is a nice little bar located in Fillmore. It was pretty easy to find and was jam packed at 11pm on a Saturday night. The vibe to the place was really nice, yet busy. I loved the décor, very hipster. The place is a wine and beer place only, which I happened to really like. I ordered a delicious Amber Ale for only $5, which is a great price for a drink in SF. Tables are difficult to snag, you have to be pretty lucky. I am also glad there was a restroom here, which is located in the back. I would definitely come back to this place!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
If ya need a fix of old Heman carton then this is the place. Oh and they also have a great wine list. 

The ambiance is a dimly lit extremely intimate bar. With brick walls lined with 2 top bar tables. It's clearly a couples or date night spot. There is a bar in the back that feels a bit like a diner bar at pork store or some bfast dive. But the small bar makes the place feel small and urban. 

The staff was low on a Tuesday night but I can walk my own drinks to my table. I'm just glad to see a nice bar in japantown.
author: Joseph M.

description: cool concept. really loud. not really for studying i guess... more for social. think id really like it if i came for just an night out for drinking... too bad I was trying to study. Still very pretty place! And friendly workers! Gets pretty crowded even when they just open so it must be pretty popular place. Check it out!
author: Betty L.

description: This is a great place to go for a drink and some game time! I checked it out with my boyfriend and we played Uno for almost an hour. I ordered the sangria which was pretty good but a bit strong for my taste. I liked the variety of board games they had, and they were playing some great music. I'll be hanging out here more often hopefully!
author: Sam F.

description:
After eating at SPQR, my friends and I wanted to get some drinks.  Checked my list of bookmarks and decided to check it out. 

Once you walk in, there's music and a movie projecting to the  left side which is all brick. I believe last night's movie was half baked with Dave Chappelle. It's an intimate bar, I loved the right side where there's a small table and foldable chairs attached to the wall, looks like you're floating. 

Anyways, some of their drinks were creative. Didn't get a chance to try their food but I know there's cheese and bread, the standard pairing with wine. 

Will probably come back.
author: Jessica Z.

description:
The taps were not working very well the night I stopped in but the bartender was on point with her suggestions for bottled beer! That being said, I'm certain the taps were quickly fixed and all is well on that front.  

The atmosphere is certainly unique! It is a small place with an upstairs DJ booth that's used sometimes in the evenings.  Apparently this place has coffee during the day but it is definitely a bar at night.  They have games too if you bring people who want to do something other than just sit and talk.  The seating is pretty awesome too, with these little seats and tables that are attached to the wall. 

Beer was cheap compared to some of the other places I've seen around. I'll definitely be back to try this place out again.

Oh, and free wifi, just as for the password.
author: Jenna E.

description:
Awesome cafe bar hybrid where you can sit down with a friend, get wifi,  study with coffee or relax with a nice mixed drink or beer. 

Stays open late consistently, awesome place
author: Allen S.

description:
- Locale Destination -
It's on Geary Blvd and Webster St in San Francisco.

It's right across street from the Japanese town or little Tokyo?!?! (I don't know what it's called ;p) I'm a tourist, so I don't know about the area, OK? Bear with me ;p

Decor is simple, hip, chilled and almost like a bar. Coffee, scones, wine and beer etc..  Open early for booz, which is plus :)


- Gluttony Expedition -
Boont amber ale: smooth, light with a hint of bitterness. Nice!
Big daddy : very light, watery with a bit of bitterness. Meh for me.

** Both beer.

- Conqueror's Deduction -
3.5 stars. Price is decent. Nice chilled atmosphere. You can drink alcohol early ;p
Not bad.
author: Akiko I.

description: Great ambiance. Has a vintage feel to it. Love the music playlist here. Ordered latte and one of the better lattes I had in SF. Will come back here when in the area.
author: Jude N.

description:
It seems like every time I turn my head, the neighborhood in which I call home gets cooler and cooler. With recent additions to the project-lined streets like Maven (well, more Lower Haight... but still within a doable walking distance), State Bird Provisions, and now The Social Study (to go along with pre-existing hot spots like Fat Angel, 1300 on Fillmore, Yoshi's, etc...), the Western Addition sure is making a run at being one of the niftiest destinations in town.

The Social Study is right up my alley -- they carry a wide array of different wines from all over the globe, feature piquant small bites like artisan cheese and charcuterie boards, and the space has a hip, minimalist vibe that'll make you feel right at home the moment you boot, scoot, and boogie through their front doors along Geary. It's still in its infancy being open only a handful of days at this stage in the game, but as they find their sea legs and carve a niche into a part of town lacking similar haunts, I can see this being the type of place I dip into before any show at the Fillmore or an evening romp at the Kabuki. 

Beer and wine only, but word has it their sangria is second to none. Will have to give that a go next time!
author: Ruggy J.

description: It's a cool, laid back bar/wine bar. Not pretentious and you can have a conversation. Seating is a little awkward the way it's laid out. But, all in all a good addition to the neighborhood.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Cutest and probably the hippest cafe I've been to in a long time. My friend and I wanted to kill some time and grab a snack before our concert at the Fillmore so we popped in. Lattes taste great and the ambiance of the cafe is amazing.

Seats pop out the side of the walls and the theme of the cafe has a sort of New York artist loft feel to it.

I see this cafe as a cute date night location and will be back!
author: Audrey C.

description: Just stopped by for a quick cappuccino. The decor/atmosphere of the cafe was really cute and hipster. If I'm ever in the area again I'd come back and actually study or read here.
author: Estelle C.

description: This is such a cool little spot! Love the beertails and fun games the have. The atmosphere here is totally my jam in my old age...ie can't stand not hearing the person talking to me a foot away or being constantly groped. Totally a laid back spot to come with some friends and hang.
author: Derek S.

description:
Upon walking into to The Social Study, I was immediately a fan. 

The interior is right up my ally, brick wall, books lined along the wall, plus quirky seating. The name really suits the place. Then for the ambiance, there's a DJ playing music out of this lifted DJ booth, which alone is pretty cool. Simultaneously, there's a silent or muted movie projected onto one of the walls. Surprisingly, I didn't have to shout to have a conservation. To top it off, they have boards games, any place with board games automatically wins me over. 

Fun fact, it's a bar by night, cafe during the day, what more could you ask!
author: Ashley G.

description: Was on a work offsite and brought our group of about 12 here between movie and dinner. Though it's a small setting, it was perfectly sized for our group and we took over most of the tables. The bartender was very generous at accommodating us and poured some really good drinks, and quickly for a group our size. I don't think they have a hard liquor license because cocktails are made with soju, but offerings are inventive and beer and wine list are good, and also inexpensive. I wish I worked near here because I would come back for happy hour all the time, to enjoy the cozy vibe and reasonably priced drinks.
author: Sarah B.

description:
The one time I went here was actually on their one-year anniversary - a friend of mine is a wine rep and they are one of their clients.

Immediately I fell in love with the place because it's so cute! And they have this great open/lofty feel. And ingenius seats that fold out of the wall if you need more seating.

I just had cider - and off-the-menu chicken nuggets/boneless wings that were pretty darn good. There was a live band, and the place just had a great vibe. 

I will definitely be going back.
author: Chloé M.

description:
great selection of drinks and bar foods.  extremely crowded on the night i was here, and there was only one bartender that also acted as a waiter who brought out the food.  totally understaffed that night.

great music too.
author: Angelica C.

description:
I can't believe I just found out about this place! It's in the Fillmore which I don't go to very often, so that's probably why I've never noticed it. I was meeting a few friends at Fat Angel for a drink, but there were no seats and the bar area is tiny. Instead of shoving our way in, we decided to go down the street to Social Study.

They have a pretty nice list of wines by the glass and they also do wine cocktails. That's what I went for and I was pleasantly surprised! I ordered a Nojito which was white wine, soda, lime and mint. So basically a mojito but with wine instead of rum. It was really delicious! For the second round I got a Agavarita which was like a mango margarita but with agave wine instead of tequila. Again, really good. My friend had a few glasses of red and enjoyed them. They also have a beer list but we didn't get to that.

The space itself is cute. They have some nice longer tables so you can fit a group of 4 or even 5. They have a collection of board games and although we didn't play we saw several other groups that were doing so. And finally, I was totally into the playlist. 

If I'm ever in this neighborhood looking for a drink I'll definitely come back!
author: Lindsey B.

description: LOVED this little gem in Japantown!  Very cute bar
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Adorable, cozy atmosphere, FANTASTIC service.

Bonus feature: enough acoustic treatment on the ceiling and walls that the absolutely kickin' sound system is never deafening or obnoxious.

It's a beer-and-wine bar, but that doesn't stop them from offering "beertails" and "winetails" - we had the "spicy coke," which pairs port wine and Four Barrel espresso, and the [excellent] sangria.

I'm not sure I'd make it a destination, but if I'm ever back in this neighborhood, this is definitely the spot to chill at.
author: myrrh l.

description:
I ll give 4.5 stars
A surprise find. Brick walls, nice music, great drinks. They also have munchies. I had a very good time. Place to stand and sit both. A cool date place.
author: A S.

description:
My mind was blown a few seconds after I stepped into this place.

I initially thought it was a bar, because the exterior implied it and I saw a physical bar area at the far end of the room.

Then, I found lounge spaces and bookshelves.
Then, I found people eating sandwiches and sipping wine on stools.
Then, I found people reading on desk spaces with candles. Freaking candles.
Then, I found people working on their laptops ON THE BAR.
Then, I found a DJ booth throned atop the narrow space.

What is going on here? What hybrid abomination is this?

The feel and design of this joint is spot on. Shabby rustic wooden furniture are combined with a crisp modern interior. Wow. 

They have happy hours, pastries during the day, snack menu at night, good coffee (Four Barrel), Taco Tuesday, and more.

I'd totally hang out here 24/7 if it weren't so far away from my place. 

---

Distinguishing factor: A bar, cafe, lounge, and club combined to make a true staple of a 21st century hang out space.
author: Nick A.

description: This place is amazing. Great environment/vibes. Tasteful music. Really liked the brick wall with a film projected on it.
author: Eli D.

description: Yikes! Their wine classes are washed with bleach and the wine is totally screwed up from it. If you are a wine lover do not go here for wine. Ambiance was very cool, very small place, you have to go to the bar to order. I was hoping for a better experience here but its worth a second try!
author: Kate M.

description: First time here and it was awesome. Great sangria and wine, quick service from the busy bartenders and the DJ was killing it. It you like 90s, 80s & Drake music with wine and friends, I recommend.
author: Maria F.

description: Little noisy for my taste -- it was hard to hear a fascinating conversation with a civilian employee of the military and how her day was going. But the wine was good. Damn guys, turn the volume down, I have aspergers and it annoys me, also it makes for better conversation.
author: Hasan D.

description: The perfect go to watering hole in a true San Franciscan sense. Drinks are good and priced reasonably. The place is spacious, well curated and homey. Service is fantastic. There is wifi and I got surprised at good mix of folks on laptops, having cocktails or grabbing beer and dinner. Love this place. The best way to end a night after eating ramen from Japantown.
author: Carla S.

description: This place was great. Great music, cool bartenders, good wine, wine-tails and beer-tails, and great snacks. The place is small, seating can get strange, and while the snacks are fantastic, I wish they had one or two slightly more substantial bar snacks. We had the charcuterie with the salami, the potato skins, and a salad. I wish we could have ordered one or two more small plates, but everything else was sort of like munchie type stuff: nuts, olives etc. Overall, great experience, totally awesome date spot, great first date material, or small friend gathering. Will for sure be back!
author: Hannah A.

description:
I love Social Study- it's a perfect spot to catch up with friends in a casual, lively atmosphere with decent seating. There's a live DJ on weekends that plays great mixes (90s R&B, what?). Beer/Wine/Soju only - they have beer cocktails!

Only negative is that they need someone on hand to bus tables- last time I was here, we waited forever for drinks while the poor bartender made several trips to collect empty cups from tables.
author: Pria P.

description:
This awesome bar ended up being our final stop as a group of my girl-friends bar-hopped in celebration of a bachelorette party. A perfect end to our night on the town. We were on foot and looking for The Social Study, based on a recommendation from a bouncer at Milo up the street. When we were having trouble locating it, one of the girls totally asked a stranger, who ended up walking us the rest of the short distance there. We found seating up front by the window toward the street and all 7 of us fit nicely in the cubby. 

Drink service at the bar was great and the atmosphere around us was really peaceful. It was the perfect end to a perfect day. Our walk back to Hotel Kabuki after the bar was short and pleasant.

The following morning, a couple of girls walked back over here for juice and said it was just as nice and tranquil in the morning as it had been the night before. The bottle of Bailey's in my purse didn't go well with juice, so I stayed in the room making coffee.  :)
author: Amy S.

description: Chill place to grab some drinks with friends.  Not really sure I would go there to study...
author: Paul W.

description:
Came in on a friday night when my sister was in town with her boyfriend and a bunch of their SF friends in tow.  The music was excellent (the DJ played an excellent mix) and the place wasn't super crowded yet.  We loved the brick walls, the booths in the side and the random board games around.

My only issue was that the bathroom situation definitely needed some help.   However, if you're looking for some chill place to hang out with your friends, then you should definitely check it out.
author: Meg T.

description:
I work next door to this business and been hearing a lot of good things. Had a break last night and thought I'd see for myself what all the fuss was about. From the moment I walked in I was overcome by a sense of "hominess", if that makes sense. The place is decorated like a study hall, hence the name. 
    The crowd is typically mid-30s or so which is chill and calm, but it seemed like most people in there were either whispering or trying to whisper. I felt like I should whisper cuz someone might be studying for a final or something. 
    Besides that and the fact that the are too dim to read the menu, this place gets my stamp of approval. Out of the dozens of bars I've been to in the city, this is probably the best place to take a load off and relax with a nice brew or glass of wine after a long day at work or school. I'll definitely be coming back. 

Oh and the bartender is super attentive and easy going, I think his name is Roger or something. I know it starts with an R...I think. Haha

If you go soon after this review, try the winter solstice and tell them Rob from KOU sent you. Deuces.
author: Roberto G.

description:
We (my husband and I) came here a couple weeks ago on our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks. 

How have we never BEEN HERE!? If I lived along the Fillmore corridor this would be a once-a-week spot for me. We were there about 5:00pm on a Saturday so it was dead, but I'm guessing that on a Friday night or Saturday after 9:00pm this place is hopping. Or at least I sure hope so. Get the Sanfragria. It's their house made Sangria with tons of fresh fruit in it and only $7 a glass.
author: Melissa N.

description: I liked this place. I wanted to love it, but I just liked it. Still much better than many other bars/lounges. Decor is pretty cool, and prices are OK. Drinks taste good, I like trying something interesting. Music is also nice, depending on your taste. I just wish the service was slightly better, but overall I think this place is worth stopping by.
author: Kity K.

description: Great place to go for Happy hour. I enjoyed the energy of this place. It played great music. Love how they play old school videos on the brick wall. Very entertaining. The bartenders are awesome especially Ryan! One downfall is their wine selection. I would come back for sure!
author: Lan E.

description:
Whoever decorated this place I seriously want to hire to do my house. Love it! 

The coffee is in between a super strong Turkish coffee and a regular cup of jo which makes for an incredibly unique flavor.

Y I think that stands for pretty much anything else on their menu...may sound standard but has a unique flavor profile. Ex -- their chicken salad which packs a bit of an unexpected spicy punch :)

Come here to play a board game with a friend or catch up on your reading whatever it is you'll enjoy yourself!

I haven't come here at night but after reading the rest of the reviews ill have to check it out.
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description: Perfect spot to study on a Sunday afternoon! You really don't see it coming when you're walking on Geary. I love the interior especially the awesome brick wall and cute Fall decorations. They have a good Mocha too! Can't wait to come back and try their food
author: Erika P.

description: Tiny little place serving up expertly crafted cocktails, plus beer and wine, paired with delicious, shareable food. My husband and I sat at the bar and ordered a food to share each time we ordered another round of drinks. Get the cheese plate, drink a shandy, or let the bartender give you a recommendation!
author: Sarah V.

description:
Really laidback setting for a winebar. Good spot to come meet friends in the afternoon/evening and whatnot. However, being a non-drinker, I came here (with a Bloomspot deal) and the goal to eat a lot of their bar food. The bar food is decent but MAN, the wait is so freakin' long. Granted, you come to these places with the idea to relax and hangout for a bit. But since I came to eat, I was pretty impatient when it took almost 40 min to bring out the four little dishes we ordered (I think there's only one person working) and then it took another 25 min before we decided to just take home the last dish because I didn't want to wait anymore.

That being said, here's what I'd order if I came here:
-The tacos (spicy but good!)
-The bread pudding was a surprise winner! Really good

These were really small to share even just between 2 people so if you come with more ppl and want to order food, order multiple dishes.
author: Diana Y.

description: Great place for doing work while knocking back a few drinks.
author: Andrew L.

description: Really cool atmosphere and they play really good music. The moscato is sweet but not sickeningly sweet- I had a taste of my friend's. I usually don't get moscato but I have to admit it was really good! There's only one moscato on the menu- definitely worth a try. I enjoyed a rose wine. Definitely will come back
author: Kim V.

description: Small  place with an upbeat vibe and funky jams playing. Decent cocktail and wine menu.
author: Marcel P.

description: Not a bad little spot - close to Japantown, and right around the corner from Origin. Drinks aren't too pricey, and they have a decent selection of wine, beer and cocktails. The atmosphere is pretty relaxed - books lining the walls, little flop-down seats on either side of small tables, bathroom is clean... They even have some board games, in case you feel like playing. If you're in the neighborhood, stop in!
author: Claudia J.

description:
Tea and marinated olives with miss Ally D. is never anticipated more than when it takes place at The Social Study.

This friendly bar sits on Geary, conveniently located on my way home. Many large tables for playing games, as well as a few little nooks for intimate conversations...Erykah Badu, Common, and Tupac grace my eardrums as I enjoy a game of UNO... a beautifully simple menu... all make TSS my spot for post-work-hangn'.
author: Jocelyn B.

description:
A good bar is hard to find. It's true. In a city that's abundant and crowded with the white noise of adult beverage lounges, the one is hard to find. You may be into the loud bustling scene of Rickhouse, or the sophistication of Press Club, or the music bangin' Badlands; there are so many scenes and choices. But if you're looking for somewhere trendy, clean, friendly, with a touch of relaxation, Social Study in the Fillmore is for you!

Taking the disguise of a café, the place serves up some of the yummiest cocktails and wine-tails. The place is complete with an actual espresso machine and WiFi, so it actually is a café. And the bites they serve can compete with any restaurant appetizer (the pork sliders were yummy). On the brick wall, movies are playing, not so much for viewing pleasure, but a nice trendy touch. And the icing on the cake, is the music flowing in the air. In my one visit, I heard Janet Jackson, the Fugees, Montel Jordan and Koffee Brown. You'd think it was my personal playlist on there.
 
Need a glass of wine to have a casual encounter with a friend? Come here. Need to unwind? Come here. Heck...it's Wednesday? Come here.
author: Jon C.

description:
Having given it a second thought and try, me and my partner decided to drop by to grab a drink before we went to dinner.

Entering in, the place was somewhat busy (roughly about 15 people) but a good quiet crowd, we walked up to the bar. 

At the bar.. 
Waiting...
Waiting...
Waiting...  (5 Minutes Later)
Looking around for a menu, I asked the bartender, the same chick again from my previous experience months prior (see previous entry) puts a finger in the air to say I'll be right with you in a minute.

(Um, ok, did she really just raise her finger to say one minute.) So once again, I looked around to see if I can grab a menu, then I asked her, "may I get a menu," to no avail she ignored me and went on catering to the people around me.

I don't know what this chick's problem is.

Observing her work as we WAITED to place our order for drinks, I can see that she's the only one working, well missy, it's time to hire someone else to help you.

What makes you think you can do it all?

15 minutes later, still waiting for a menu, I've decided to just go with whatever they had that was a house white wine. I politlely said, can I get a glass of..

IMMEDIATELY SHE CUTS ME OFF AND SAYS..
One more minute, then she goes to open up a bottle of wine.
After that she hands over the Ipad to the other patrons, sitting next to me, looks at me then focuses on another person who walks by and TOOK the order of wine for their table.

WHAT THE F*CK!

At this moment, I'm like hold up, this B!TCH sure didn't give me the time of day and she's going to order from him? 

This place has so much potential! I know she's the owner and all but damn, you are a F*cking Rude C-yoU-Next-Tuesday.

RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE

DEFINITELY will never go back. 

Yes she wrote to me awhile saying she apologized but I guess things haven't changed much.
author: Kongie V.

description: I've only been here twice but have never had an issue with the ambiance or finding seating. The Social Study is a really chill place to hang out and listen to good music, and the Sweep The Leg saketail is uh-mazing. Would definitely come back and I hope to try their food next time!
author: Jamie B.

description: The Social Study is my favorite place to hang out in SF, and I think that has a lot to do with its versatility. In the afternoon, it's a great place for an espresso drink (don't miss the honey latte!), and in the evening, it's an intimate lounge with tightly-curated beer, wine, and wine cocktail selections. What their food menu lacks in variety, it makes up in quality (whoa, those carnitas tacos). The decor only serves to heighten the gustatory experience, with its combination of books, vinyl LPs, and just the right amount of kitsch. The music is always on-point, whether it's being played by the live DJ or barista-bartender Ryan's iPod. When I'm writing, reading, or just doing some day-drinking, Social Study offers welcome respite.
author: Warren M.

description: One of my favorite cafés in SF!! It's so homey and the staff is so friendly, I always look forward towards going there!
author: Carolyn V.

description: The Social Study is the best jump-off place for a Saturday night. I love coffee/wine places, especially ones with a great vibe like them. The mood lighting and DJ really add to the atmosphere. Try their sliders!
author: Sean B.

description: This is one of two bars I went to while waiting for a table at State Bird Provisions. The other bar was Boom Boom Room. The Social Study was more classy with a unique theme. It was like a mix between a classy dimly lit wine/sangria-selling bar and a space for studying/working. They had nice furniture/light fixtures and power outlets for laptop users. This place is on the smaller side so it might not be ideal for a party of more than 6. The sangria was probably the best I've ever had because of the sweetness and hints of cinnamon. I liked this placed more than Boom Boom Room, but I guess they have two different purposes. This is for sure a spot that makes SF what it is.
author: Marlon T.

description: Love this place.  Refreshing drinks.  Reasonably good selection of snacks (cheese board, pork sliders, etc.), and free WiFi.  Heaven.
author: Kristen S.

description:
I am in LOVE with this place!  Oh man, I almost gave it Five Stars on the atmosphere alone.  It's really hip looking inside, with books and cushions and exposed brick.  It's really cozy and tucked away.  The soundtrack is almost exactly what I'd be listening to on Pandora: 90's music, with the occasional 2000's and 80's music snuck in there.  

Then I saw on the menu that they had micheladas and carnitas tacos.  It happened to be a Tuesday, so I thought, why not?  The michelada was great, even though I'm more used to the clamato and tecate variety as opposed to the red stripe and v8 they used.  It was still good.  And the carnitas were great.  The pork was soft and moist and yummy.  Just like back home in San Diego.

Great neighborhood bar that you can actually just chill and study at.  I spent a few hours working here and it was great.  The staff seems awesome; people just stopped in to chat and say hi, and the people behind the bar came out to give hugs to the people they knew well.  Definitely a great sign.
author: Erwin V.

description: Good selection of drinks, neat decor, good beats. Highly recommend if you're in the area.
author: T. B.

description: Really like this spot for the ambiance and generally awesome music playing in the background. The sangria is dangerously good. In my experience the food is overpriced for the quality/quantity, but I usually just go for drinks and get dinner elsewhere. I've always had pleasant experiences here.
author: Jessica G.

description:
I was looking for a nice coffeehouse to do some work and found The Social Study via a ScoutMob article on laptop-friendly coffeehouses (http://scoutmob.com/san-francisco/scoutfinds/4385). Very attractive space, friendly owner, great coffee. I was there between 11 am and 1 pm. Several parking spaces were available nearby. This is on the south side of Geary just east of Fillmore.

The big wooden tables will seat six, but at first I had a table to myself to spread out my paperwork. The owner offered and brought me a glass of water without my asking, which was very nice. The wifi is free (the owner will give you the key), and it worked well.

The downsides are minor: Outlets are scarce because of the brick walls. Some conduit along the floor could take care of that. There were outlets at the bar, at the table nearest the bar, and at tables near the window.  As pretty as the inside is, the view outside is of a a wall of the Geary underpass.

I would have spent more money if they served lunch, but the kitchen doesn't open until 4. I'd have liked to try one of their beers, but didn't feel at ease doing that in the middle of the day without something substantial to eat with it, so I contented myself with a very good brownie and a very good cup of coffee.  A cold sandwich, a salad, or a slice of quiche would have been a nice simple lunch option. 

I'm glad I visited The Social Study and would visit again when I'm back in the area.
author: Michael B.

description: Fantastic lounge.  Such a great layout.  Looks very similar to a couple places I know in the daikanyama neighborhood of Tokyo.  DJ booth in a loft-spot.
