Movies projected onto the brick wall.  Staff is super friendly.  It's mostly a wine bar, but they have beer and wine-based cocktails.  They also do great espresso drinks through closing time.  I just love it here.  Probably one of the coolest, clean but non-pretentious spots in SF.
author: mario k.

description: Not too loud, dim lit, not too crowded. Great food and great sake cocktails. Friendly bartender. I think its perfect for a date night.
author: Neha H.

description:
Whoever created this place, knew _exactly_ the type of place they wanted to create.

Also... Spicy Coke!
author: Jason S.

description: Went in last night after seeing a movie at the Kabuki.  Nice, casual place, decent beer and wine list. Didn't have a cocktail but tried the food.  The Cuban sliders were good and the BLT really yummy.   Perfect for a late night snack or light dinner.  Bartender friendly and extremely efficient!  Crowd was late 20's & up.  We were on the older side but still felt comfortable.  Apparently there are nights they have a DJ...might find more of a younger crowd then.   Will definitely go back!
author: Chris W.

description:
Seriously, I've found my new favorite bar. 

I came here on a breezy Friday afternoon and was checking out The Fillmore District. I wanted to have a libation after my long walk from Noe Valley so I consulted Yelp and stumbled upon this beauty. Harmony, the owner, greeted me kindly and helped me decide what to try first. 

First up - a light mixed "beertail" that has lemon and ginger in it! So Good!! And completely appropriate for after 12PM :P 

While I sat at the bar, I had a lovely conversation with Harmony. What  I liked most about this place was if you wanted private time, there is plenty of space for it but the people of this place made you feel really welcomed. Striking up conversation with people was very easy here. 

I stayed reading and chatting for about 3 hours. I definitely will be back again to check out the night crowd.
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
Cool vibe, great music but giving it 3 stars b/c sub-par service.

Came with my date who waited for me for about 10 minutes.  He told me in his text message he ordered wine.  When I arrived, I had assumed he had already guzzled a glass of wine and they cleared his glass.  The waitress came up and asked for our order.  He had to remind her that he ordered a glass of wine about 10-15 min ago.  She apologized and then informed us that table service is not what they usually provide and to go to the bar to order.  

We also ordered a salad which had an interesting mayo based salad on top.  It was of decent size and was actually quite good.

I would definitely go again b/c aside from the customer service, it definitely has a cool ambiance.
author: Avant R.

description: This place is amazing.. if only my 5th grade social studies class was like this ;) Great date spot too!
author: Melissa E.

description:
I came to Social Study with some friends for a solid pint of Guinness on the beautiful afternoon of St. Paddy's Day 2013 (disclaimer: it was still early so I wasn't drunk yet at that point). The place has got a sweet atmosphere, and the staff were super friendly.

There were a bunch of (what appears to be) students working/studying there. The atmosphere certainly makes it a good place to do just that. They had comfy chairs, which fitted well with the tables, which fitted well with the stuff hanging on the walls, which fitted well with the hipster-ish looking upper "deck" in the back. 

I would definitely go there again, and would recommend others to visit.
author: Don L.

description:
Good place to have a caffeinated libation or something poured out of a bottle especially after a long grueling day at work. The place has a definite hipster vibe. Low key, inviting and genuine are words that come to mind. If you're looking for a pretentious place this ain't it. It's physically perched a little past the corner of Geary and Fillmore. This places it on the "other side of Fillmore" and reminds me of H St and the early days of the U St corridor back in Washington DC. But hey, the less DBs and carbon copy clones around the better. There are plenty of neighborhoods where they already frequent.
I had a cappuccino the day I was there. It was well executed. The coffee had a kick but not the dreaded over-roasted/some would say burned aftertaste. There are also  small plates for you to play around with if you are so inclined and your stomach just won't stop gurgling. 
Great addition to the neighborhood. Not all great things need to hide out in the Mission.
author: Jahan T.

description:
The boyfriend and I were out on a Friday night...looking for a new neighborhood place to grab a cocktail. After a quick Yelp search...we found ourselves at The Social Study. 

The space is kind of hidden (which I loved)...right off of Fillmore. It had a hipster vibe to it, yet they were playing old school R&B and The Big Lebowski was being projected on one of their concrete walls. Interesting mix, but I was digging it. 

They offer a large selection of wines and wine cocktails, as well as a small menu (imagine cheese and charcuterie plates). I do wish they offered liquor, but without a license, they make up for it with the rest of their drink menu. 

Note - not too big of a place...so you might have an issue with a large group, unless you're willing to just stand around. But if you can snag a table or bar stool...you'll stay all night. 

Overall...I'm happy we stumbled upon this gem in the neighborhood. You should check them out soon.
author: Dru M.

description:
My friend and I were walking around aimlessly and semi argued where this place was since it wasn't easily spotted.  But going to enough bars (yes, I sound like an alcoholic) I know there's a lot that are "hidden" but are amazing fines.  I was determined to find it and luckily we got there. 

Cute place with books around.  There were mini booths on one side and longer tables on the other...I'd recommend the longer tables.  The booths, however nice, are actually not very comfortable and feels awkward to sit in.  I ordered some wine while my friend tried a wine cocktail.  Both were good and it's a great place to chill, hangout, bring a date, etc.  There was a dj upstairs playing music which may seem odd but he was playing pretty good chill music.  It wasn't like it was a club up in here.  It just felt like a really really nice library/bar in someone's expensive house.  LOL
author: Kim D.

description: Cutesy lounge with a very intimate vibe right around the corner from State Bird, I stopped here for a quick drink and catch-up and liked the fact I could still talk in my normal voice and actually have a conversation over a few glasses of wine here. Very cool.
author: Taffany H.

description: I got a nojito and some pork sliders there recently, and oh boy, I experienced food poisoning for the first time in my life! Within one hour after I ate there, I started breaking into a cold sweat and feeling dizzy and nauseous. It was right before a live show and I had to rush out through the screaming crowd and vomit like a baby. It was the worst feeling I've ever had. I'm sure it was the food that I ate there that got me sick because I hardly had anything else to eat all day that day.
author: Molly S.

description: Delicious sake cocktails perfect for sipping. Nice spot for unwinding with friends and good music. Only downside was it closes way to early.
author: Renee G.

description:
This is my favorite lounge and coffee place in the City!

The vibe here so so cool.  Funky smooth R&B in the background.  Wonderful soy lattes.  And, unlike most coffee places, open late.  I really like the brick walls.  It reminds me of the imaginary loft I want to own, but can't because I haven't won the lottery, yet.  Plenty of 2-seater tables.  And, nice long benches for those large groups.
author: Jack R.

description: Nice place but there was only one waiter for the entire place before a Fillmore show. Waiter was very nice, though, and handled the situation as best as he could. Also they only have beer, wine, and soju. Soju cocktails were tasty.
author: Tu T.

description:
The husband and I stumbled upon this place after a movie at the Kabuki. We were in search of a fun, new place to get some wine & cheese and we found it! The Social Study is a small place with beautiful exposed brick, great school/study decor, excellent R&B Jams circa 90's and early 2000's, sweet bartender and great wine. I would definitely go back again for more great ambiance and chilling.

Only bad thing is even w/the WIFI, our phones did not work so well on Shazam (we were trying to tag all the old school jams). Even w/1 phone ATT & the other Verizon w/4G, didn't matter. Oh well, that just told us, "Get off your phone and ENJOY!"

Please stop by if you're in the area. You won't be disappointed. :)
author: Ms. B.

description:
Holy Crap, this place is amazing. 

Seriously, I am not kidding, I cannot give this place a high enough rating. The ambiance is great (mid-century school library meets wine bar), the wine selection is great and the food is incredible! Everyone who works there is awesome, the music is awesome, the free WiFi is amazing.

This is my new favorite corner in SF.
author: Matt L.

description:
My friend and I came to study on a beautiful Sunday afternoon.  All the cute little cafes in Japantown were packed so we had to do some yelping to find a study spot nearby.  The Social Study (appropriately named) popped up and we decided to give it a go.  I've always passed by this place on my runs and was meaning on stopping by.  I guess this was the time.  

I love the pillowy, velvet blue walls with the built in chairs that you can fold down.  Such a cute layout!  However, both the seats and the tables attached to those walls are tiny!  Those seats are definitely not meant for bigger people or for studying.  It's meant for two people who want to drink.  Since we needed some space for our laptops and books, we took two seats at the tables, which were also very narrow.  The music they played was awesome!  I was jamming out to every song.  But it can be a little loud if you're trying to study.  There was only one bartender too who was busy trying to make everything.  I think this would be a good date place, evidenced by the couple next to us who were clearly on their first date (and probably met through online dating. lol).
author: Tori Q.

description: Came here to have a couple of drinks before heading to kabuki. Beer and wine. Crowd is typical lower Pac heights people, young professionals. Not a place for food although they have happy hour. There was one bartender there who took a while to serve drinks so it isn't a place to go crazy and do shots. Ambiance is sort of laid back. It's a small venue with small tight crowds. We were here on a Friday night probably. hard to find a seat so be okay with standing and talking. Not crazy loud, definitely a place to start your night and not ending. Pretty ideal place to get a drink before reservations somewhere or a drink after dinner if youre not quite ready to head home.
author: Elton F.

description: To break up the "coffe/wifi shop" monotony I popped into The Social Study to do some homework last week . The service is great, the decor is pretty cool, and for a bar, this is actually a great place to get some work done due to it not being a traditional "bar". Most of the patrons are young professionals and everyone is quietly working on whatever it is they're working on. The only thing keeping it from being a 5 star is the volume of the music; it's two notches too loud to effectively concentrate, at least for me.
author: Amy C.

description: Nice place for coffee and pastries in the morning. Came here on a Saturday night and it is transformed into a bar with a DJ spinning beats. The food looked good, although I didn't have any. Solid sangria. Too loud to have any kind of conversation though but that is expected. Beautiful interior.
author: Lori E.

description:
Back to school.

You could do it like Rodney Dangerfield: http://youtu.be/iRpUAdI_F_o

Or you could just attend a Social Study session.

Easily one of the most stylish classroom you'll ever be in thanks to the exposed brick wall and vintage books and albums assorted throughout. Adds personality and class.

Stay awake with Four Barrel coffee and research that paper on Wikipedia courtesy of the free WiFi.

Evenings brings bites like a veggie sandwich with house cranberry sauce and cream cheese. Availability of adult drinks are a pleasant reminder this is not high school.

On some nights you'll even find DJs and movies projected on the wall.

While the coffee wasn't too memorable and the sandwich was overpriced ($9) I'm still very much a fan. Just love the design. And the staff has a great energy and passion for what they are trying to build.

Homework is to come back for drinks. It's an assignment I look forward to completing.
author: Jason B.

description:
This has to be one of the best bars in the neighborhood.

The atmosphere is inviting and energizing without being too much. It is a great place to work during the day and stay for a drink at night. I'm sold
author: Andrew N.

description: Cute little place with reasonable drink prices and interesting decor. The reason I'm only giving three stars is that my friend's "sangria" was absolutely rancid!
author: Kira G.

description: Nice neighborhood bar with above average coffees, wine/beer cocktails and food. Small space with a cozy atmosphere. If you are lucky enough to score a seat, sit down and enjoy the menu. I love the cocktail called the Spicy Coke which is grilled port, four barrel espresso, lemon, coke all at the reasonable price of $8.00. The honey latte is out of this world. The staff is efficient yet courteous. A great spot if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Victoria O.

description: What a fantastic little nook to go for a good glass of wine or delciious cup of coffee. I happened upon this place post-dinner and waiting for a concert at the Fillmore. You would never know it was there. It's low lighting is very inviting, and the padded walls with stackes of books make you feel like you're in a deep, dark library. It's cozy and trendy, the exposed brick wall behind the bar looks rich with age. I loved the live DJ playing great jams that I could move my shoulders to, yet also have a great conversation with friends. Loved it.
author: Dia Z.

description:
social study looks like a subset in the corner of a library. only  sign at door suggests they sold four barrel coffee here. inside no signs seen suggesting they sold sangria, etc.

pour: four barrel coffee(3)
-very smooth, no harshness at all
 -drip version also available
eats: :day old croissant(1)
-tasty

coffee drips: 
-on the metere so didn't explore this place
-very friendly service
-definitely would come here over starbux.
author: Victor G.

description: Really cool little spot. Great aesthetic and atmosphere. Great coffee and several beers on tap.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Wah, waaaah....over-hyped.

While it seems like a nice option in the neighborhood, the execution fell a bit short. The sangria everyone raves about is not all that and runs you about $9 a glass. I held off on writing this review because I wasn't sure if it was my personal taste; met with my friend tonight and she felt the exact same way about the bar and the sangria!

I guess it's good to give this place a go but not my cup of tea.
author: Rachel R.

description: This place is great!!! Order beer, wine and snacks at the counter. Pretty good selection of drinks. No pressure to leave. Games, the paper and more to entertain.. Relaxed environment.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
This was an incredibly perfect spot for our bookclub gathering. 

We sat at one of the wonderfully long solid wood tables with tall but comfy seats. I enjoyed a nice croissant with my morning black tea while my companions had coffee with their pastries.

My gaze drifted occasionally to the padded wall. Had I been more awake, I might have tested it properly. 

Every once in a while I felt a tinge of nostalgia during one of the many songs playing in the background- not too soft, not too loud - and certainly not too distracting from our bookclub conversation. 

Excellent spot to meet a date, meet some friends, study, or get some love letter writing done.
author: Loli L.

description: A very cozy and small bar, great place just for a conversation and a few drinks. It gets crowded around 9 till 11 and then it dies out, on a Friday . Nice vibe. Although , I will have to rate their drink as ok, 2.5 stars. I had the white sangria and it was horrible , very bitter.  Other than that a glass of red wine was nice.
author: Nhung T.

description:
There's a tiny part of me that wants to take a star off because Social Study doesn't have liquor, but that's nothing compared to how great this place is.

On weeknights, it's a great place to just hang out with your friends, get some drinks and chill out. The video on the wall is great, as are the tunes and sometimes you can zone out in between conversations.

On the weekends it varies from pretty chill to busy--but I have yet to see it slammed. And there are so many different places to hang out, from booths to tables to the bar, that you can pretty much make it any experience you'd like.

Did I mention they have coffee? Good coffee.
author: Paul C.

description: Craft cocktails are delicious. This is a couple blocks away from where I work and is a nice cozy place to hang out with friends. It was a weekday and there wasn't much happening. I'd come back here to get the night started.
author: Christina L.

description: I really like this place.  It's small, really cute, great wine selection, the food is delish, and there's a decent beer selection as well.  It has everything you can ask for in a little neighborhood bar.  There are seats that fold out of the wall that remind me of being in school.  They play old movies on the wall.  The staff is super friendly and attentive regardless of how busy they are.  And there's a fish that is cute that lives on the bar.
author: Allison R.

description:
I hate to give a new establishment a so-so review, but my first visit to the Social Study was a bit less than stellar. 

A girl friend and I came in at around 8:45pm on a Saturday night. We were the only two patrons in the establishment as we came in just as a couple others were leaving. No one greeted us, so we decided to seat ourselves. A quick look around and we saw some wall-seats (two-tops with small tables jutting out of the right-hand wall; seats without backs), and some bigger tables for groups on the left side of the room. Since no one else was there we opted to sit at a bigger table. We sat for a few minutes but no one came around despite seeing the bartender at the bar, so we grabbed some menus from another table. After perusing the menu and making our choices over the next several minutes and still nobody came around, I got up and placed our orders at the bar. Strange that despite being the only two in the whole place, and especially for a new establishment, the bartender and other staff made no effort to greet us or offer us any tips/pointers about the menu.

We each had a glass of SANFRANGRIA ($7) and we shared the BRANCH & BOARD CHEESE PLATE ($9). The sangria was solid - I liked that they included fruit in our glasses and that the apples and pears were not so wine-soaked that they were inedible. It was nice to munch on a few cubes of fruit along with our cheese plate.

The cheese plate was fine - it included a blue cheese w/ honey, a gruyere, and a cheddar, with a small cluster of grapes and a couple of small slices of bread. The blue cheese paired very well with the honey. Unfortunately, the bread was fairly stale, and there were not nearly enough slices of bread for the amount of cheese on the plate - there were only 6 pieces of 1.5" rounds of bread. Eventually I was smearing blue cheese onto the slices of gruyere and cheddar as we ran out of bread. The cheese plate would be much improved if they included either more bread, or opted to offer some crackers instead. 

Note about the ambience: The room was quaintly decorated and was sufficiently dim for a low-key feel. The music could use some help - it was way too loud and I couldn't discern any theme to their mix. At one point they were playing oldies, which then turned into pop and even some EDM. Hmm...

Over the course of the hour and a half we spent there, the bartender only came by to bring us our sangria and cheese but she never came by again to ask how we were doing. A man, who appeared perhaps to be the owner, came by once to ask us how we were enjoying our drinks and cheese. At one point, a large group of people came in and congregated near the bar area. They appeared to be the bartender's/owner's friends, and the staff dedicated all their attention to this group of people while ignoring the two of us. Eventually when we wanted to pay and leave, we took out our cash and had it laying on the table for quite some time. Clearly no one was paying attention to us, so I got up and handed cash to the bartender, who took the money without asking if we wanted any change. We had included enough in the amount of cash to account for tip, but it was a bit rude of her to not even look at the amount and ask if we needed change. 

Overall, the prices were fair and the ambience was fine save for the music being too loud. They've got a great concept going on and a solid menu and drink list as far as I can tell. If The Social Study could fix the bread-to-cheese ratio and seriously improve their customer service, I could see myself coming back.
author: Megan L.

description: Nice little pub I stopped in at after dinner around the area they have a cozy feel with books on the walls and brick with soft chairs along both walls. The music was mellow and relaxing with a good crowd of people. The crowd on a Saturday night was mostly white and around older 20s to 30s. Bartenders were nice but a little bit slow the drink selection is limited not a full bar they don't have whiskey and stick to their list of prepared drinks. the drinks were good but nothing amazing
author: Kurtis C.

description:
I checked out the Social Study last night for the first time with a large group of friends. We all had a freaking blast. Intimate ambiance with a modern loft feel: exposed brick, steal beams, high ceilings, with DJ mixing from the loft area. This sexy lounge is located in the Fillmore, so it's surrounded by lots of energy and great restaurants. The DJ was mixing up all kinds of nostalgic beats - 90's hip hop, 80's mash, he was definitely serving up a hot plate of the meow mix special. 
 
The snacks were delicious - we ordered the Board Meating with two kinds of salamis, prosciutto, crackers, sour dough sliced rolls with some chili dipping sauce; The Marinated Olives - were solid and a generous serving; The Cheese Plate with an array of complimentary cheeses that paired nicely with the wines. 

The Sangria is on point. I was dangerously downing these tasty beverages and nibbling on the pieces of fresh fruit... yes I said FRESH. My gf got the Nojito - an exotic approach to a classic drink. My other friends ordered sangria's, Malbec's, and of course we had our beer drinkers. 

Service was friendly and prompt considering how packed the place was and how large our group was (15 heads) 

If you dig the Lounge vibe then you will love the Social Study.
author: Diana G.

description:
This is a great addition to the neighborhood.

A perfect spot to visit after catching a movie or dinner in or near Japantown or Fillmore. 

The ambiance is comfortable and hip. 

Service was excellent. The owner, Harmony, was behind the bar and she is incredibly friendly.

This is the place to go if you want to have good conversation with others and not feel like you're yelling to have a conversation with each other. Very chill-out place.

I'm definitely coming back and telling friends about The Social Study. My new "go to" place for a drink and hanging out when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Dan N.

description: Usually when I'm out and about and computer enabled I'm having coffee. Here though, on Saturday afternoon, wine seemed like a better approach - and it was. After a couple of glasses, everything was ever so slightly better. The BLT was good too, especially the small side salad that accompanied.;
author: J T.

description:
The Social Study is a very sexy study lounge.  I can't get enough.

The vibe is very chill--a Little Dragon's "Constant Surprises" and Prince's "Purple Rain" type of chill.  With a full bar slanging Sangria, beer, espresso, and ginger lemonades, The Social Study is great for a post-work wind/e-down.  There are also good "study snacks" for the adult palate.  I have yet to try the Sangria, but it's on the bucket list.
author: Diane N.

description: I've walked past The Social Study numerous time over the course of a year and finally made it inside! My expectations were a lounge with a full bar, however, I was surprised that they didn't have liquor-- this did not bother me. The Social Study makes up for this with delicious beer and wine cocktails. On the Friday night that I visited there was a great DJ spinning 90's - current music in the balcony and the place was packed, however, I was able to find seating for me and 4 friends. I will definitely come back but with less people, i'd like to be able to drink and hold a conversation which proved to be a struggle when speaking over the great tunes the DJ was playing.
author: Isidro M.

description: One of my favorite places in san francisco to grab a drink. Good wine selection and they even serve warm cookies.
author: A M.

description:
Great little bar off of my beaten path. I just hope I remember that it's here in order to stop by here when I'm nearby.

I liked the design of the side tables.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Good place to to get a drink or coffee with a friend or date. 

Very rustic/vintage and easy place to study at with free wifi and plenty of tables. Only complaint was the lack of outlets.
author: Vincent H.

description:
I woke up from my late afternoon nap wanting coffee beer, and remembered seeing coffee and beer on a sign downstairs, so I ventured out to see what they had to offer. 

We walked in, and there was ample seating, so we sat along the wall. We ordered our drinks, a honey latte (delicious) and I got the chocolate expresso beer (I can't remember the name of the drink, but it was divine. It went splendidly with my honey latte.) It was exactly what I woke up craving! A nice Guinness stout with expresso syrup, and shaved chocolate on top.. mmmm.  The BF got their Fillmore Shandy and a cappuccino, the shandy was delicious as well. I also ordered their veggie sandwich, which was very tasty and light.

Overall, definitely going to be visiting more often. Their food was great, the bartender was friendly, and the decor was very welcoming. The food selection is pretty minimal but filling. I want to see what their wax poetic after dark events entail, it seems like a lot of fun.
author: T M.

description: Love coming here with my girlfriends.  Great atmosphere and we always have a lot of fun!
author: Leslie K.

description:
Update March 2012: I'm adding another star because Harmony and her crew deserve it. She knows how to treat her regulars right, or anyone else in off the street. They've also added a happy hour and the tacos and sliders are bomb dot com!

Now that I've tried several things off the menu, I feel safe in writing a review. I live just on the next block, and I definitely agree that I'm glad I don't have to leave my hood if I just want a beer or a coffee and a low-key, but comfortable hang out. Believe me, that wasn't true when I first moved to the hood in '04.

Harmony makes a great latte (not a huge Four Barrel fan, but she does right by it), and I could drink a tennis bracelet's worth of Yellow Diamonds - a sparkling winetail. If it's got bubbles, I'll drink it. I like to stop by after farmer's market on Saturdays which is perfect if I can't decide on coffee or alcohol or both. I like the oldies R&B on the turntable perfect for chillaxin' and dreaming up what I'm going to cook with my farmers' market veggies. They've usually got some nice pastries, too.

I dropped by after 4p the other day to check out their cheese n charcuterie boards. For some reason, I assumed it was a sandwich, but close enough. I chose Fiscalini Cheddar (try Fiscalini Gold - great local cheese) for my Branch and Board plate. One of the meats (which I've forgotten already) would be great for a picnic if you're a bacon fan - smoky with paprika. I liked the vibe at this time.

I do like the ambiance - exposed brick, dark wood bar, timeworn books atop the shelves, and a rich looking upholstered blue wall with jumpseats at two-tops.

Hmm ... and I was just wishing for a place where I could read a book and have a beer or maybe play a card game with a friend where my choices aren't limited to coffee and tea.

I'll be looking forward to a few more menu items and a happy hour. I've got to try the sangria, and it's good to know I won't have to get behind the wheel to get home.
author: Myla A.

description:
Really, really, really wish they had a full bar, because I dig the vibe here so much. I'd describe it as upscale dive... interesting interior, funny little wine/beer "cocktails," tall bar tables, and games to help you pass the time away.

Haven't tried their coffee or food, but would definitely be open to it. 

Only downside: the little tables that are attached to the wall. I'm short, but even tall patrons couldn't get their feet to reach the floor. Without a bar to rest them on, I felt like a child--and felt extremely uncomfortable.
author: Allison S.

description:
Very cool place to hang out at if you're just looking to hang out with friends in a halfway quiet setting. It's also a great place for a first date as they have two-person tables along the wall that keep it intimate.

It's a beer and wine only bar. Drink prices are what you would expect from a San Francisco bar but the atmosphere makes up for it. They always have a movie playing on the wall via projector and the DJ plays legit music.

You don't see many fights in this place because it's away from Doucheville (Marina) and the clientele that come in are mostly there to have a good time.
author: Michael S.

description:
Great place to hang out with friends and actually carry a conversation while enjoying some quality drinks or coffee (Four Barrel!). Come here if you want to avoid belligerent drunks and hot, sweaty air.

They had a DJ there spinning up some smooth background music to add just that light touch of classiness to an awesome visual ambiance.
author: Moses L.

description: Hip-Hop, loungy, gourmet coffee, and beer on tap. What more can I say, but you have to check this place out. The bathroom was decorated by prince and the interior bar looks so comfy I want to stay here all day. I ordered the BLT, proper. Great staff as well. Support this place!
author: Kato D.

description: Really cool spot- 5 stars on decor and atmosphere. 1 star on the quiet scale. They play really loud music which makes it feel like you're in a club. Not what I was looking for when trying to read a book on a Saturday afternoon!
author: Mitch G.

description: The bar was great. The beers were awesome. They had a random documentary playing which was actually quite interesting. The dj rocked and the ambiance was really nice. Apparently they do coffee in the morning? Would repeat.
author: Matthew C.

description:
I'm a big fan of Social Study, if it was closer I'd make it a regular stop. Nice vibe, great coffee. Best music I've experienced so far in SF - mostly old school R&B and hip-hop. Personally I can't ask for more. Bartender is lovely (I apologize for not knowing her name); she's super friendly and does a nice job engaging with customers. 

Free wi-fi but can be on the slow side at times.
author: Mika O.

description: Loved it! Great music, drinks and over all vibe for early Friday night! I had a yellow diamond, he had a Guinness espresso creation. Super delish and not overpriced. Whoo!
author: Kelly L.

description: Good vibes for easy drinking and catching up with friends! Close to the FILLMORE West and the every busy Statebird PROVISIONS restaurant line up just around the corner.
author: miriam b.

description: Awesome wine/beer and bites bar.  Cool vibe and interior decor (exposed brick walls and dark wood), surprisingly good food for apps given its not a "restaurant," the perfect place before a movie at the Kabuki or a show at the Fillmore.  Quiet enough for real conversations if thats what you want.  Not a huge place so best for a couple or small groups.  A super addition to the Fillmore/Geary area.  Thanks Social Study!!
author: Christin A.

description:
I went here on a Friday night for a friend's birthday party.  We got to sit in the window area, which probably enhanced the evening.  They have a good selection of beers, and the ambiance was perfect for a Friday night.  

They need another bathroom.  They only have one single occupancy bathroom, and the line got long.  Curiously, the bathroom is extremely large and could probably be split into two separate rooms.  Behind me in line were 4 young women who ended up pounding on the doors screaming "Whatever happened to chivalry?"  Geeze, was I supposed to let FOUR women go ahead of me in the bathroom line?  That is absurd.  They expect me to be chivalrous, yet they were completely unladylike.  And let's be serious, if I had let them go ahead of me, they would have been thinking, "OMG, this creepy guy just wants to hit on us in the bathroom line!"  Right?  I didn't just fall off of the turnip truck yesterday.  This wasn't my first trip to the bathroom.  I've been to the bathroom a few times in my life.  

 I have to remove one star for the limited bathroom situation and the douchebags in the bathroom line.

P.S. If any of those impatient young ladies are reading this, send me a private message and I'll show you how much of a gentleman I can be.
author: Bill V.

description:
The perfect hang-out!  Cool factor and cozy at the same time.

Fun drinks, yummy apps for sharing. I love this place because it has a great set up for meeting a bunch of friends and adding more as the night goes on. Plus the live DJs!

The interior is cool with seats that fold out of the wall and common tables for mixing crowds and making more friends.

Can't wait to go back again :)
author: Laryssa S.

description: This place is chill and intimate. Came here for pre dinner drinks. I love the ambiance, they have candles through the place. I order the amigo tacos and they were delicious. The bartender was very friendly and talkative. He told us they have a DJ 3 days out the week and that he mixes great music. I would recommend this place, specially for a 1st date so you can talk and relax. I hope to be back really soon.
author: Kari V.

description:
A welcomed addition to the neighborhood and the perfect fit to what was missing.

First, a couple of tips:

1) order at the bar (this is also written on the menu)
2) the Social Study only serves wine and beer / cocktails

Second, here is why I gave the Social Study 5 stars:

1) great vibe - mellow, cozy, and warm
2) you can actually listen to music and carry on a conversation...look up and you'll notice sound proofing on the ceiling
3) drinks - the sangria is just one of the tasty drinks on the menu

And third, things are only going to get better:

1) happy hour - is coming
2) live music - is on deck too
author: Joe M.

description: Awesome space with cool chilled vibe during the day and hot tunes after dark. Servers are very friendly and know how to make a cocktail !
author: Upkar L.

description:
Great place..amazing atmosphere..friendly service and brilliant music!.. Helps that I live a block away..a top neighborhood bar!
Cheers
author: Nav N.

description: I love the idea, just not the execution. The Social Study is a bar/cafe/lunch/dinner/study place, meant to be a hip place that people can both work and socialize at. But truly, it's impossible to get any work done here, due to the blaring pop music that prevents you from thinking. And the food and drinks are simply unremarkable.
author: Sidney L.

description: Cool coffee/wine bar. Perfect for that pre-dinner warmup with some friends. Loved the vibe in here and the little booths. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.
author: Eric B.

description:
Great little pre-game spot.

Wine: Nice selection but pricey.

Food: Limited menu but items looked good. I couldn't afford the prices after choosing a $$ wine but with a group - would be great.

Dinner after: State Bird Provisions! It's right around the corner :) Rated #1 new restaurant this year!
author: Rachel C.

description:
I love The Social Study!  It's my favorite place in The City to grab a glass of wine with friends.  Whether we're starting our evening or swinging by for a nightcap, there's always a fun, relaxed crowd.  Harmony - the beautiful owner/bartender - creates an awesome atmosphere by playing an unusual selection of movies on the brick wall.  Who doesn't want a nice chardonnay to go with Karate Kid or maybe a merlot with Scarface?  And if you're looking for a little snack, Earl's Nuts are delicious!  ;-)

The Social Study is a unique and special place!  Check it out!
author: kristan l.

description:
This place is super cute. I love how the name of the place ties in to its theme. You can sit here and study on the chairs that mesh into the walls if you're not using them. The brick walls also add a nice touch. The books are also real. My curious boyfriend always likes to touch things so of course, he picked up a book.

I actually came here for a private hosted party at night-- so there was only beer and wine being served. I'd come back for some coffee though. Too cute to not hit back up.
author: Kathy Y.

description: Very cool spot. Distinct vibe with a nice beer and wine selection. Worth a stop if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Bonobo M.

description: Hit up the Social Study after an epic fail of a concert at The Fillmore (too many teenagers in weird PLUR "outfits" aka costumes), and was immediately HOOKED.  This place is perfect for a ladayz night out or date night.  Great drink menu, awesome music (every song was like, "Oh I love this song!"), people are cute, bartenders are nice, etc., etc., etc.  Go here.
author: Hailey H.

description:
This place is so hip it almost hurts. Just kidding, it's A1, highly recommend. Not to do homework of course, which is what my friends and I attempted to do. The music was a little too loud (and inconsistently random??) for quiet homework purposes, but the aura of this place was like no other. 
It was captivating: bricks lining one wall, books lining the other; a cool menu that included slightly overpriced ginger ale; old-school rap and Michael Jackson mixed with jazz; really cool semi-young people hanging out and tapping away on their laptops. 
It really is an experience that is not to be missed. Try it once and see for yourself.
author: Idk A.

description:
BEST SPOT IN THE FILLMORE!!

Love the atmosphere (exposed brick with navy blue walls) and the staff is crazy attractive.  

They only serve beer and wine, but the prices are very reasonable and the Sangria is delicious!

I will be back as often as possible to listen to the dj spinning my tunes and have good conversations with friends.

Finally a bar that you can feel comfortable just hanging out and reading a book in, yeah I know I am a dork.
author: Jasmine D.

description: Really great location to sit down and study for a few hours. The barrista was extremely friendly and gave me an exquisite ginger limeade. Highly recommended. Gotta keep coming to solidify my love for this place.
author: Juan C.

description: I've somehow made my way over to The Social Study a few times in the past few months. Tucked away on Geary, TSS is always pretty busy. Drinks are good, they consistently have great music playing and a cool moving running on one of their walls. It's not a rager type of bar, but the perfect place to grab a drink while waiting for dinner reservations at State Bird Provisions around the corner.
author: Christine A.

description:
We live in Pacifica, but often spend A LONG day in the City.  Last weekend, I was looking for a place to have some down time between shopping and restaurants and sailing - to just sit and relax maybe read, and consult the internet for mail n stuff. Starbucks for this purpose has just become old.  I googled and yelped around and found this place:  coffee, wine, snacks, and wi fi.  

Like most of the reviewers, I love it and wish it were closer to home.  I love to happen upon cool places like this.  The bartender / barista was very welcoming and kept a cool stream of music going - I kept asking, "Hey, what is that?"  I "discovered" some great new music.  LOVE.  I liked the fact that I could decide if it is coffee time or wine time ;)  (Pah Starbucks!)  The swirly cinnamon bread was warm and tasty; scones, bellissimo.  There was an eclectic smattering of people studying, reading, wandering in, meeting - purple-haired girls, old black dudes who talked scat like they just put down their smoking guitars, buttoned-down suits sitting at these crazy desks-for-one attached to the wall on their computers.  Regulars and first-timers.  Anyhoo, it's in a weird place we don't usually pass through - but we'll change our route ;)  It's a great place to meet friends before or after a night (or day) on the town.
author: Liana R.

description:
LOVE this place. It's in my hood, never too crowded, excellent drinks, coffee, hours and bartenders. Did you watch Fashion Star? Well one of the 3 finalists sometimes tends bar here and shows you his incredible sketches. Michael is the other bartender I always have, and he's SO nice. 

And the Nojito is a cute version of everyone's favorite, the Yellow Diamond and Shandy are tasty. Good cheese and charcuterie plates too. Come in the AM for Four Barrel coffee and to do some work, in the PM for a drink or two. Walk home. 
 
Geary and Fillmore, next door to Nan Noodle Bowl on Geary.
author: Lily K.

description: In love with this place. Take a date here and get inquisitive. Take a friend and catch up on what's been happening the last few months. Take your MacBook here in the afternoon and have a latte, getting that project done that's been getting close to it's deadline. This is all of those place and then some. Bar tenders are fun, bites delish and  the wine selection is fantastic for the price. The characters you meet here and amazing connections you make is what this local hot spot is about. I love you Social Study.
author: Tari Y.

description: Decided to come here to get some work done and get some coffee. The honey latte was great, and the atmosphere, though louder and a bit darker than I expected, was great to finish up some work related things. I didn't try out the bar, but it's definitely on my agenda now. As past reviewers have commented, I'm surprised it wasn't busier, because this place is great!
author: Lina L.

description:
A friend and I stumbled upon this new addition to the Western Addition/Fillmore District and ducked inside to investigate. 

Really rad space! Exposed brick adjacent to rescue, blue couch cushions. Innovative ledges and tables jut from the cushioned walls to provide intimate two top seating.  Unfortunately it's comfier on the eyes than the ass, but the large tables and chair make up for the lack by providing ample room for studying.  Additionally few couches offer lounging for long chats with friends. Given it's attributes, "The Social Study" is an apt nomer. 

The Social Study offers Four Barrel Coffee, but AVOID the drip coffee! It is not made by the cup as I assumed rather lives in a store bought plastic urn for who knows how long. My cup of joe tasted old/bitter, and I later found a bunch of sludge at the bottom and in my mouth upon final sip. For $2.50 you deserve better. 

INSTEAD get an expresso drink.  My friend's latter was delicious. Good expresso and quality baristaship on the foam. 

Despite the step-backs I optimistically rate 4 stars. The spot's only been open a few months and will inevitably iron out it's kinks because it has already got a good thing going.
author: Quentin J.

description:
It's true they only serve beer & wine but they do a creative job with their mixed drinks. Try the nojito & the yellow diamond, you'll be very impressed. BUT stay away from the michelada - it's nothing like the real thing. It tasted like a bad bloody Mary with beer. A real Mexican michelada has lots of lime/lemon  with tomato juice & this didn't compare. Sorry. 

Anyhow, if you're looking for a hip wine bar (not your avg wine bar) with a cool hip vibe where you can have great conversation over good music, this is the place. It fits perfectly in the Fillmore & I'll definitely go back before or after a movie at the Kabuki!
author: Susie O.

description:
Café by day, wine bar by night, this cozy space is a welcome addition to the Fillmore, a 'hood I admittedly don't get out much to these days. 

They have some really good, reasonably priced wines on the menu and do a damn good michelada. (Swoon!)

Plus, on certain nights, they project corny movies onto the brick wall. Suggested pairing: cheese plate with three-plus micheladas.
author: Christina S.

description:
The Social Study is overall great. The food and drinks are fantastic, as is the ambiance and decor. However, the seats against the wall are less than ideal.

Don't get me wrong, they look great, and the whole interior is well designed, but the stool-like seats leave you hanging. I mean that literally, I couldn't figure out a way to sit on them comfortably because I didn't know what to do with my legs. They just dangled. I tried standing, but only ended up in everyone's way.

That being said, try and score a spot at the bar or a table.
author: Amanda P.

description:
The newest addition to my hood, and a much-needed one.

The ambience here is great...very low key, great music, good selection of wine, beer & wine cocktails. The Sanfrangria is really tasty!

The hidden wall cushions, while a cute idea, are a bit painful for anything longer than about 1/2 hour. Perhaps if there were a little footstool for those of us on the shorter side, or a back that came up, it would be better. I don't think I would sit on the wall again without some changes.

And, while it is written on the menus, it is important to note that you must order at the bar. We did have a bartender come around and get us a refill, but that was a nice to have and I don't think the usual. (this is not a knock on the place at all, it just took us a minute to notice this on the menu so I thought I would give others a heads up)

Can't wait to go back.
author: Annie F.

description: Always walked by this place but never paid much attention until I ended up in this area right around happy hour. Stopped in for a drink and ended up ordering their tacos and bbq sliders as well as some of their cocktails. Everything was delicious! Very cute decor, great place to catch up with some friends or a date! Music was a little loud for "studying" in the afternoon. Great spot if you're in the area for HH, but not sure if I would go out of my way to come to this bar for nightlife as it is tiiny.
author: Vivian D.

description:
If I could give the Social Study 10 stars, I would. This place is doing everything right... they serve Four Barrel coffee and baked goodies during the day so it's a great place to work. At night they turn into a cozy neighborhood bar with a small food menu and a great atmosphere. The servers are always friendly and on the ball, and the music they play is great. I've never been there when they've had DJ's or movies projected on the wall, but I'm sure it's awesome. 

My only gripe is that their kitchen doesn't open until 4pm, so if you're having a long work day your only food options are pastries and baked goodies. I usually have to go somewhere else to get lunch. But I think the owner has recognized a need to add some daytime food options for us telecommuters.
author: Michelle L.

description: I loved this place! Sophisticated and chill atmosphere, good service, comfortable setting. I could see coming here and doing a little bit of work thanks to the free wifi as well.
author: Allison L.

description: Inexcusably poor service. I inquired as to whether the bartender/barista recommended a particular mixed drink. He, despite it being his first day on the job, responded that he did. The drink was DISGUSTING. I hand it back after two sips and order a beer. At the conclusion of my stay, the bartender/barista insists upon charging me for the recommended/terrible/unconsumed drink. I have been a service professional for over two decades, and it makes me sick to my stomach to think that this person can claim to be in the same industry. I used to be a regular at Social Study, but some affronts simply cannot be brooked.
author: Seamus B.

description:
Great Ambiance!

Friendly staff!

We'll be back for live music and snacks.  This is a great spot for before/after a movie at Sundance or before a show at the Fillmore.
author: Laura G.

description: I hope they update Yelp! with their menu.  I wasn't sure until I went, but they do serve more than just some random appetizers.  They've got a bit of a food-food menu, something beyond a snack plate.  Cute atmosphere, decent coffee.  I haven't been here for drinks in the evening, yet, but it looks like a fun place to try.
author: Lauren C.

description: Very nice atmosphere, friendly bartender. The drinks were pretty good and they had a deal for two pulled pork sliders and an IPA for $7. I had the pork tacos which were AMAZING and a Chocolate Factory (Guinness, espresso syrup, and chocolate shavings). Bartender was even nice enough to give me another small glass of Guinness on the house. We went on a Sunday evening so it was kind of dead but the bartender kept the conversation going the whole time. Definitely coming back the next time I'm in SF :)
author: Natasha L.

description:
why is family guy so inappropriately funny?
why does facebook double as a landing site for airing dirty laundry?
why is rainbow sherbet so delicious?

it's true that there are liberties taken when you work from home, but they can also be quite a hindrance when you're trying to get some serious work done.  thank the lawd for places like the social study.

there are no long, comfy couches where you can cuddle and look longingly into your significant other's eyes.  there's no extensive liquor menu for you and your bros to take advantage of.  this is not the place for daydreamers or severe, drunken tomfoolery.  

as sterile as i've painted it, the social study is also an attractive, contemporary space w/a chill vibe.  a few medium-sized benches, stools, and one lone, cushioned seat are scattered within this lofted space.  the juxtaposition of the blue, padded wall and the brick wall is a nice touch.  i only wish that the solo tables had more surface area.  you can barely fit a laptop on it.

the highlights are:
- free wifi
- AWESOME selection of music  (i mean, who plays shai anymore??  a few of us couldn't help but sing along!)
- four barrel coffee*  

*sure, jane is a stone's throw away from here w/free refills, but their coffee tastes watered down compared to the social study's.  if you're an avid four barreler, you'll definitely taste the difference.  plus, the pretty gal behind the counter (whose name i haven't caught yet) gave us a free refill AND topped us off in one visit.  she's always been very friendly every time i've had to escape the distractions of my home.
author: Ting A.

description: Great ambiance and excellent music! One star off because the drink I had was terrible. But of course, it's alcohol, so I drank it....
author: Tiarra E.

description: This place is incredibly amazing: people are nicely dressed, drinks are good. And the most important part, the staff is incredibly kind and helpful.
author: Islam I.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. I came here once a week for the first month that they were opened. I came in during the day, hoping to avoid any crowds or annoying drunk people. And 3 out of the 4 times I was here, the owner (I believe) brown haired girl, was okay, but she just never really made conversation. And believe me, I don't come into places wanting the conversation, but if you saw me once a week for over a month in an almost empty place, and I tried making conversation about the ipad POS system and suggesting square cardcase, that just maybe she would ask me if I lived in the neighborhood, or telling me about the bar so far. She was polite, but doesn't seem to be a natural at customer service. At least with females about her age. She did make a lot of conversation with 2 regular guys a couple of times. 

Despite the lackluster conversation, and the mediocre music during the day, there also is no good snack/food option before 4pm. The pastries never looked very exciting. It has such a classy/hip vibe, that I'm surprised they don't take note of some easy bar snacks like at Alembic. Good olives, upscale nuts, chips with a whipped dip. Seriously, go check out Alembic for some tips on adding some amazing food on a bar/coffee snack menu. A customer even brought her pizza one day from down the street and they both ate it right in front of me. It made me cry a little inside because I was so hungry.

Also, San Franciscans like drinking deals. I believe they have a happy hour now, but I'm talking make it really worth it. With places like $2 beers at Bean Bag Cafe, half off pizzas at Fly Bar, or the 8 million scoutmob/groupon deals in this city, clearly you need to up your game. 

As others have said, the seating here isn't really designed for camping. Which is fine for a lounge night place, but during the day it is a bit painful to watch people on their computers sitting uncomfortably. 

I think I would start coming back here if I knew the girl wasn't working, and if they had some day specials to make it worthwhile. I like the whole concept, and I love the location, but I just never had a great experience there. I really don't see this place lasting unless they make some serious adjustments.
author: Courtney s.

description: The Three Amigos Tacos and Beef Sliders are ridiculously good.
author: Jena C.

description: The Social Study just did it right. Harmony (the owner) had a very clear vision which was executed perfectly. The Social Study reminds you of all the great little spaces in the East Village that make downtown Manhattan so unique. Whether you are going to catch up with a friend, meeting for a first date or just looking to get out on your own- The Social Study caters to anyone looking for a relaxed and enjoyable afternoon or evening. Fabulous service, delicious food, good live music and there's always a classic movie playing on the brick wall. I highly recommend this The Social Study to all personalities and all ages- it's just great :)
author: Hael S.

description:
First off, love the name... Despite the absence of spirits, the drink menu is highly palatable. The mix of clever drink names and invigorating ingredients using only wine and/ or beer as a base is a refreshing change from the typical runaround. As for ambiance, this place feels very comfortable, almost as if I'm just hanging at a freinds loft... Good music, great design and laid back grounded staff (Michael is amazing! And harmony, who owns it is a necessary flower in the decor). Once again, a refreshing change from most wine bars, which feel like wine cliques...
If you don't drink, still 5 stars or the food... Quick savory bites, with an impressive variety considering the size of the kitchen!

I'm definitely going back:)
author: Nikita M.

description: Hard keeping up the Potatoes Skins N Bacon with BOH appliances:( Although, your day needs great vibes, tunes & crowd- the Social Studys genuine brunette beauty is putting SanFran foundations first, while hosting a mix table above the bar to play board games below while enjoying a cold IPA
author: Jimmy M.

description: Very small and cute place. Atmosphere was a bit like a library, I felt like everyone could hear your conversation because of the size of the place. The place had a decent amount of folks mostly sitting around reading and on their laptops on a Sunday afternoon. Happy hour sliders from 4-7p. No decaf anything here. Nice baristas. Good music.
author: V V.

description: Nice lil gem.. Great service, nice wine selection, lil bites to eat... My bf and his friend are studying while I read
author: blair k.

description: Small, loud party bar for Klub Kids - uncomfortable seating, blaring techno & hip hop (even in the afternoon). If that's your scene...
author: tw s.

description:
Super sweet spot.

A lot cooler than anticipated. It doubles as a bar/cafe but the ambiance and decor is so unique. It's an awesome find and chill spot to meet up with a friend to catch up or do work on an afternoon. I would recommend this place-- it has a LOT of character and is one of those great finds in the city!
author: Lissette L.

description: Great little neighborhood joint! It's a pretty casual atmosphere - gotta order your drinks at the bar even if have a table and can sometimes have slower service but I love the feel of this place. There's always some random movie playing and tunes from each every era which always has my fiends and I guessing the artist, year and song. The ambiance is hippy chic with reclaimed wood, leather and metal interior finishes. It's got that comfy, I'll have another round feel!
author: Leanne S.

description: I don't know about for others, but trying to study over loud R&B and gangsta rap tends not to be very effective.
author: Alan P.

description: By far the best wine bar on Fillmore! The library decor is super cozy, the bartenders know their wine and can make mean cocktails. They also have good small bites and plates to share. This is by far my new favorite spot on Fillmore to meet friends for Happy Hour. I always go to meet for one drink which ultimately turns into 3 or 4 plus food cause this place just has the best vibe!
author: Kristi E.

description: While I agree with previous reviews that the place is aesthetically pleasing... It definitely doesn't work as a coffee bar/internet cafe.. .perhaps a relaxed bar?  Laptop unfriendly (i found 1 outlet in the whole place next to the window with 1 available plug) and uber expensivo for joe (3$ for a normal size mug and $3 refills-- are you kidding?).  A better place for four barrell coffee is just a healthy walk up Fillmore at  Jane Cafe ($2 a cup with FREE refills and a fair amount of plugs for people who like to study on their laptops).  Jane also has decent food at anytime of day- for some strange reason Social Study doesn't serve real food before 4pm, just day old scones, bananas, and chocolate muffins.  Their tapas menu did sound appetizing however.  Has potential but i'm not satisfied that the owners have really defined what they're trying to be yet.
author: Merritt W.

description:
Great music, delicious snacks and pastries, four barrel coffee and espresso, very nice wines, and the people that work there are pretty amazing too!

Love everything about this place, you should check them out!
author: Ess M.

description: The social study is a great spot near my apartment. Its a great spot to chill, do some work, or hang out with friends. They music is great and they offer both drinks (beer, wine, sangria,etc) and coffee. It's a unique spot!
author: Richard P.

description:
Ambience is one of the best I have seen in the City. But I still cannot understand the loud and jarring music playing from the speakers during day time.  I can understand the desire to be musically expressive and loud during evenings.  But why during the day time?   

What is wrong with all these indie coffee shops?  They are like "Let me find the most annoying, arbit and haphazard musical arrangement to portray my uniqueness, and then pipe it up to a million decibel level.  This way my customers have absolutely no way to enjoy the sip of what I am really known for or carrying some work during the peace of the day".  

Maybe I am the only one feeling like this but I surely won't come solely to enjoy coffee, do any work or study.  I am going to go back to Royal ground coffee shop, a few blocks up Fillmore.  Doesn't have the same ambience and the coffee might be just a notch lower, but the overall atmosphere is very serene and simplistic.

Finally, the bartender seems to be friendly or willing to look or sound friendly only to locals, not noobs like me.

If they pipe down the day music, I will update this review.
author: Krish R.

description: Came here on a whim with a friend one Friday. The place is pretty neat. The decorations are nice and the fold out seats. The service.. is kinda crazy. The place is small so you don't need a lot of people working but the bartender is playing everything but coat check. He takes all the orders for both drink and food serving both people at the bar and not at the bar. Perhaps I was here on an off night, but it seems like there needs to be a waiter/waitress helping with the orders. Other than that, I really enjoyed the bar and the atmosphere. I will be back and recommend to other people.
author: edward k.

description: The Social Study is a great addition to the neighborhood (Fillmore / Lower Pac Heights).  Great spot for coffee or drinks.  Try the sangria for sure!  Steps from theaters like the Sundance Kabuki, The Fillmore, and the jazz places.  Great atmosphere, great staff, and great patrons!  I can't wait to go back!
author: Joe S.

description: I absolutely loved this place. I'm always in the market for places to go that have great ambiance to have a good conversation with a friend, feel classy and aren't too expensive. And I finally found one! This place is like a library lounge, with books, leather, wood, some soft lighting, and great music. They have my favorite wine, Sexual Chocolate, by the glass, and really good food. My friend and I split the cheese plate, the salad and the veggie sandwich. All were excellent and moderately priced. This is a great place to just catch up with a friend in a classy and fun environment - I will definitely be back again and again.
author: Courtney A.

description: Unfortunately, nifty interiors don't equal good coffee. I could only get through 1/2 of the weak, watery mocha I ordered. My wife's cappuccino was equally uninspired. Too bad, we were hopeful for this place. Maybe when the cafe transforms into a bar at night it's better?
author: Dan B.

description: Best Michelada I've had in San Francisco! I like the ambiance and hasn't been too crowded when I've been.
author: Jonas H.

description: I didn't like the wine selection in terms of quality. I didn't try the food bc I didn't see anything that i wanted to pair. There wasn't a cheese plate or charcuterie or lil nibbles or its or something. They had tacos and stuff, which is fine but thats not what Im looking for when i goto a wine bar. I felt the music was blasting and tasteless. Its ok to have loud music if its later in the evening but 430 ish, I felt the person that worked there wanted to rock out. It was loud and i trying to unwind, but i guess I'm a buddy duddy.  I thought the space itself was was quite charming, i loved the exposed brick but the wine selection needs to be upgraded.
author: First L.

description: I went in for a going away party the first week they opened and thought the concept was pretty cool.  I love the decor and the whole set up of the place.  They have a DJ booth upstairs and seats that pull down along the wall.  So far, everything that I tried in regards to food and drinks were delish.  I had the sanfrangria, meat and cheese plate, yummy bold red wine, nuts and olive trio, and pastry.  The co-owners were very cool people and know how to start a nice venue in the central part of the city...Jtown!
author: Sandy L.

description: Wine, books, a DJ that plays hip hop and R&B circa 1991. What else could a girl want or need. I love this place.
author: Mahta P.

description: A good beer and wine selection (not lots and lots of choices, but what they have is excellent), with a creative and tempting cocktail menu. Free wifi, cozy leather wall treatments with book and warm brick decor, and group "study" tables make it a great spot to visit!
author: Steve F.

description: Cool new spot....nice place to chill and have a glass of wine or beer. They had a dj who was mixing some cool chill music.  Do yourself a favor and check it out.
author: Dilly M.

description: Solid place for beers, wine, and mocktails.
author: Aaron A.

description: Really great wines, meats and cheeses. Snacks and beer. Clearly, they care about what they are putting out. You walk in and immediately feel comfortable. Plus this place looks great and has the right ambiance. I love a place like this in the this neighborhood. I would usually hang out a little further down Fillmore but now this place is perfect. So close to where I need to be.
author: Suzanna G.

description: Expensive appetizers!  Drinks are watered down.  But the dark wood decor is nice and location is convenient with ample parking.
author: Byron L.

description: My favorite bar in SF - low key but not empty, very cool vibe, great drinks (and coffee if you need a Friday night pick-me-up). Great prices too for SF. Great for pre-dinner drinks in Hayes Valley or on Fillmore.
author: Maren H.

description: So glad I found this place. Great coffee. Love the vibe. It's becoming a second office for me. Definitely worth the five stars!
author: Travis C.

description: Affordable drinks and tasty looking snacks.  Cool atmosphere, laid-back bartender.  However the wall booths were quite uncomfortable, and I wish that they mixed up the music a bit.
author: Kim K.

description: Stopped by here for a couple of drinks with some friends. Like this place a lot. The ambience and setup of this place is super cool. The music they played here was great - a bunch of really good old school classics that adds to the vibe of this place. Will definitely be back!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Leaning into the padded walls in this place helped me nurse my Seis de Mayo headache.  I started to smellucinate what they could possibly be serving  in this effortless cool urban bohemian looking hipster of a place in Lower Pac Heights-- Since I'm neither from Bohemia nor am I a hipster, I did want some more stiff drinks to ease out of my headache.

The Social Study, is a library-like part café, part lounge, part bar or part 747 cockpit sans the seat belts hangout. I didn't know whether I should have card cataloged my order first with the bartendress or  put my tray table up with my seats in an upright and locked position then find the stewardess button.

Since I was sobering up, I couldn't help but stare at the communal table and the long wooden bar, or the pale-blue, studded-leather wall fold-down seats, all  while trying studiously to absorb what's written in this library like bar menu. I liked what I saw because it was diverse in category but focused on the good selections. I thought a pitcher of house made sangria might be good; but no, I wanted to drink my dessert and try the cocktail (Chocolate Factory) that had some Guinness, some shots of espresso and a smidgen of chocolate syrup; but wait, I also wanted to try some red wine like  'sexual  chocolate syrah/zin 2010' or  'cucao carmenere'; but, no, I was tempted by some whites like 'augustus viognier' or 'count karoly gruner'; but, hold on, they also had a list of winetails like 'sanfrangria', 'nojito', fillmo'sa' (proscecco and tangerine); oh, but there's a nice selection of bottled beers, from Jamaican  Red Stripe, to some local  Arrogant Bastard Ale, to Belgium's Chimay Peres Trappistes; ---at last, I decided.  I opted for some Fillmore Shandy of Schrmshaw Pilsner, house ginger and citrus. I thought that might go well with Earl's Nuts (that's roasted nuts some sage, cayenne, chili and brown sugar, not my hoe friend's favorite play thing).
author: Reyz A.

description: This cute little small is a great bar tucked away just off Fillmore Street.  They don't serve hard alcohol (whch is why this only gets 4 stars) but they have creative soju cocktails which are certainly worth trying. Friendly staff, eclectic atmosphere.
author: Julie F.

description:
Social study is such a great neighborhood cafe and bar! I'm so glad it came to the neighborhood. For the morning, they serve four barrel coffee - so yummy! And they have delicious, fresh pastries. For the afternoon and evening, they have an extensive and eclectic wine and beer list. Plus, the owner has come up with fancy wine and beer-tails that are refreshing and unique! Oh, and there are great nibbles and snacks available, like their new charcuterie sandwich with fatted calf salami!!! AMAZE-balls! 

While the food and drinks are great, the ambiance is the best feature. The 90's R&B and old school jazz music set the mood (live dj friday and saturday nights!), and a cool, exposed brick wall anchors the atmosphere as professional and hip all at the same time. 

Lastly, the owner and staff are amazingly nice, helpful, fast, and fun to talk to. They know their regulars and take care of them. I cannot be more happy with this place. A true neighborhood gem that fits in to (and dare I say, defines) Fillmore street's evolving character.
author: Alison C.

description: A very cozy, intimate bar with a very local, low key vibe, and a friendly non-pretentious staff and clientele. I think it's one of the better places for a (first date). I hope this place makes enough profit to remain open and establish itself as one of the cool, off the beaten path spots in San Francisco.
author: Arkady I.

description: Love this place, good music, relaxing chill spot.  Great local bar.  Very artsy and really laid back.  beer wine and sake only.  more mature crowd.
author: Shirley H.

description: Please hire someone to handle tables on Saturday night - it is to crowded to make your bartender bus tables.  You could be making so more money.  Why are you wasting time?!
author: Leanna R.

description: Adorable funky cool design and great music.  Super nice owner and staff.
author: Melanie C.

description: 1 or 2 glasses of wine turned into 6 glasses and 3 hours of conversation. Dont call me a lush, but yes I loved it!  Love the decor! Bathroom walls were really cool too.  The DJ booth is upstairs and the way they get up there is through a wooden ladder. SO cool, reminds me of climbing up to the top of a bunkbed.  Such a cool place to go for some wine and cheese and meats.  The guy who was tending to us was super nice! And then to find out later on in the night that he was part owner. I would definitely want to come back here and next time, I will order a bottle instead by glass and must try the sangria.
author: Gina S.

description: Best sangria in SF hands down. I'm so glad I found this Fillmore gem.
author: Anthony C.

description: what an awesome bar to hang out at or pregame. love the music and the decor!
author: Lisa N.

description: First time in and I am already scheduling a return visit. When I'm working at a coffee shop, it must have the right atmosphere and this crew gets high marks across the board. Communal and two-seat tables, old school music that enhances and doesn't distract, and great coffee earn the first three stars. Service with a smile gets the fourth. And the fifth star goes to the sumptuous blue leather upholstered wall.
author: Jason R.

description: A merging of Brooklyn-esque vibe (exposed brick walls, cool asymmetry in a loft space), California little foodie touches (a+ for the olives, perfectly brined) and a nice wine list n' wine n' beer cocktails to keep one entertained. Great to have a new comer in the neighborhood.. Service is fantastic, familiar and just the right amount of sassy. I could see coming alone for the wifi over a glass or with friends for a meet up pre-show at the fillmore. Great vibe.
author: Rachel S.

description: Great spot for meeting friends to chat. I love the space, good music and you must try the sangria.
author: Danielle W.

description: Such a cool place.  Still a WIP but when they are done it will be even more awesome than it is already.  And for a bar the food rocks; appetizers only but enough variety to fill you up.  Yum!
author: Greg R.

description: Drinks are okay, but I like the ambiance and decor. The bartenders are really friendly.
author: Coco L.

description: Have wanted to check out The Social Study for some time.  I was pleasantly surprised. Loved the decor, music, menu options, overall scene.  Welcome to the neighborhood!!
author: Kelly M.

description: Been to the social study about a half dozen times.  Each time was a great experience.  Such a unique place in SF.  Harmony and her team treat you warmly each and every time.  Guinness, Wine and Coffee always delicious and available but try the food - surprisingly good.  Such a unique find.  Cool hangout place.
author: Jefferson T.

description:
this spot reminds me of a hipster version of your typical old school coffee house sans couches and with better coffee.  communal tables, beer and wine along with internet access means this place will not stay empty for long.  it was when i went this afternoon, but the service was friendly and the music was perfect for a rainy day.  

i can see how the mood of the space might change from morning to night, but all in all a great place to hunker down and get some work or studying done while sipping on a $9 glass of sparkling wine.
author: Luisa A.

description: Went on Friday For the first time because Fat Angel was too crowded. Ordered the 2010 Zinfandel at the bar. Saw the server fill most of my glass from the bottle, and then when he thought I wasn't looking, pour in wine from a glass that someone had already drunk from. Gross. And besides that, the food was way lackluster, and the sangria was watered down and too sweet. Should have just waited at Fat Angel.
author: jessica d.

description: FINALLY! A decent coffee bar that doesn't require hauling ass to the Mission or SOMA. I discovered the Social Study en route to the Unsafeway and finally got around to visiting yesterday. Dream come true! Plenty of seating, gorgeous design, option to socialize (I demurred out of anxiety but I will do my best in the future) and lots of space for writing or drawing or what-have-you. La Marzocco machine makes a very nice cappuccino and the Four Barrel choice is very much appreciated. Will be back as soon as I can afford to leave the house again.
author: Amy S.

description: My favorite bar in SF. Awesome drinks, Neo soul + soul + alt rock for a soundtrack, the 'study snack' food menu, movies at night, four barrel coffee, and plenty of books to read. Need I go on?
author: Roop K.

description: The little tables and seats attached to the wall that fold out are wonderful for creating space in here, and surprisingly comfortable as well. Easygoing atmosphere, very study friendly during the day and there's simple transition to evening into a hip bar. Serving Four Barrel coffee is a plus.
author: Christina V.

description: This place absolutely rocks. Harmony and her husband make SS one of the most inviting cafes I've been to any where. She is very much a people person and it shows in how genuinely she interacts with all of her patrons. But besides the people, decor tasty menu, the music can't be beat. All day and night they play old skool soul and hip-hop. My nickname for SS is "Cafe Shazaam" because that's the app I'm always pulling out to ID the old skool joints that I here when I'm there. Could it have a few more outlets, sure. But I just bring a splitter and extension cord and I'm fine. It's a very unique place and definitely worth at least checking out the next time you're in the Fillmore.
author: Eric W.

description:
I've been twice - for coffee only.  This review is limited to the coffee.
The coffee is not hot.  I, and most, like hot coffee.  The coffee was good otherwise.
However, like a lot of new coffee bars, the place is trying  to be condiment hip.  Stevia is NOT a good sugar substitute - not sweet and leaves a metallic aftertaste.  Why not blue or pink packets?  Where is whole milk, or even 1/2 & 1/2?  Soy milk and lo-fat milk only.  Let me decide for myself what I like in my coffee.
And the coffee is expensive:  $2.50 for a small.  It is not THAT good.  The entire package for a coffee drinker is not appealing.  
The atmosphere/environment is nice.  Especially if one is not drinking coffee  ha ha.  Better for the wine/beer crowd later.
Windows were dirty (noticeable since the entire front is window - which is nice) and many cob webs above.  
I'll go back one more time in a few weeks.  I think this place might make it with the wine/beer.  But it is not a coffee destination, and to attract morning coffee drinkers, it needs to be a destination since it is out of the way. I hope they make it.
author: Bob M.

description: First time visit yesterday early eve, nice atmosphere, music not too loud and enjoyable, good soy latte, pleasant staff, some vegan options for snacks, close to Sundance Kabuki Cinema, SF Film Society Cinema, and 38 Geary Bus.
author: Bob G.

description: Go to this place if you have plenty of time to waste in order to order a drink or food. The ordering process is a total chaos. Bartender was very rude and not attentive. The only good thing about this place is the ambiance..
author: Jan K.

description: Nice beats with casual atmosphere. Great selection of boutique wines. Perfect place to drop in and chill.
author: C. P.

description: Social Study is my favorite place in the Fillmore for a latte Monday through Friday- the coffee is delicious and Harmony the owner and her staff are the best. I found out this weekend that it is also the best spot in the Fillmore for a party- the drinks are fantastic, the food is really really tasty, and the atmosphere is ideal for hanging out with a group of friends. Social Study is stylish, intimate and comfortable all at once and your guests won't want to leave! The best!
author: Alexandra M.

description: Went to the Social Study last night based on a friends recommendation and we absolutely loved the ambiance, the wine and cheese plater. Great place to unwind and relax. My girlfriend and I love the place and will differently be back.
author: Michael S.

description: good ambiance. food generally very good. music a bit loud for my taste. one problem: $11 for a cheese plate that was embarrassingly skimpy. perhaps the cook does not realize the price???
author: randy b.
